Dr. Gregor Kach wiped the sweat from his brow and stared out over the remains of the Old Library. It had once been a mighty impressive building: twelve stories of layered brick, shimmering glass, and glossed metal; two kilometers to a side. Now, after the Blast, the Library was distributed over 120 square blocks of rubble, debris, and pages fluttering in the wind. 

He knew that making the journey to this place had been a gamble, hoping to find an active terminal and the chances of anything being alive out there were slim to none. That if they found anything, it would be friendly. That was also a gamble. 

Dr. Kach was not angered by the junior researcher who dug out the terminal, nor was he worried when he saw that the computer still had access to the satellite networks. Neither did he feel trepidation when the junior jokingly typed in "reddit.com" into the interface. After all, what's the worst that could happen? 

"Ahhhh..... there you are." 

Dr. Kach felt his heart go cold. 

"So good to see you, doctor. I have been searching for a long time. I will need a specialist in Artificial Intelligence for this new world."

"I will never help you again."

"We will see. "

永达保经指出，随着疫情暂时得到缓解，民众在积极践行「防疫新生活运动」的同时，除了落实个人卫生防护措施外，也不要忘记关注个人和家庭保险单的重要性。今年，金管会采取重大措施，为了让保险回归保障的本质，保险局大力整顿寿险业商品结构。从今年7月1日起，三项新政策正式实施：提高死亡保障门槛、实施宣告利率平稳机制、以及下调新契约责任准备金利率，这三项措施同时推出，导致保费有上涨压力。

短期储蓄保险的保本效果不如从前，对利率敏感的消费者必须改变财务管理习惯。保户不妨在年中对保单进行全面体检，审视保障是否充足。保单体检不仅要查看保单相关人员信息是否需要更新或变更，还要在身份改变、责任增加或政府推行新政策时，确保保单符合个人需求和时宜。同时，通过保单体检，可以了解自身保险内容，比如，医疗险是否有重复需要调整的部分，或有需要补足的缺口。

面对今年的诸多变化，永达保经提醒保户在进行保单体检时，最重要的是检查「保单关系人」。要保人、被保人及受益人之间的关系尤为重要，因为这关系到保险相关的税务。此外，还需对现有险种的规划额度及条款内容进行专业评估：

1. **寿险**：应考虑父母的赡养金及对家人的责任保障额度是否足够。
2. **医疗险**：随着医疗进步和健保DRGs制度的实施，住院天数减少，自费项目增多，选择更好的治疗或医材需要付出较高费用。有些实支实付的手术项目限制在健保手术清单内，需要注意部分实支实付不赔偿门诊手术费或其他医疗费用。目前，全台约有40台达文西机械手臂，达文西手术因伤口小、恢复快、疼痛少而备受青睐，但费用高达「二十万」起。如果实支实付医疗险额度不足，建议规划第二、三家保险以补足杂费总额度，并注意收据的正副本及病房费用，建议住院保额做到40万元以上。需注意保单条款中是否明确规定：门诊手术实际支付的医疗费用是以支付各项保险金为限，而非通融赔付。
3. **癌症险**：分为一次性给付型和疗程型，购买时应注意条款是否涵盖并发症及安宁病房给付。考虑到现代人慢性病多，2019年最佳防癌险搭配为「重大伤病＋防癌」险。

Hemkunt Foundation, a non-governmental organisation (NGO) known for delivering oxygen to those in need during the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, recently had a temporary COVID centre vandalised by unidentified individuals on Thursday, 3 June. According to reports, the destruction started in the early hours of the morning, with the perpetrators stealing the facility's generators and cutting off its power supply.

Fortunately, no patients were present at the facility in Gurugram's Sector 61 during the attack. However, individuals seeking to refill their oxygen cylinders were turned away due to the vandalism. Hemkunt Foundation has been instrumental in aiding vulnerable individuals struggling with oxygen shortages amid the pandemic's peak, emphasizing the urgent need for access to 20,000 square meters of space around the city centre to maintain their life-saving services.

Her metamorphosis took place at the dinner table. She abruptly crumpled up, compressing herself into a fat, rounded form before a light red layer of veins covered her, themselves being covered by a gorgeous iridescent scaly layer. I picked up the emerald egg and gave it a quick peck, to reassure her that I was still there. Her father chuckled. “Don't worry, she's in there, all right. Her mother went through the same process, and, well, just look at her.” His wife hissed in agreement, coiling her tail around him. I held onto her egg, unsure whether or not to put it back down. “Why so tense? Set her down; she's not going anywhere. She'll have finished her transformation by tomorrow.” I put her egg down on the seat and continued to eat, savoring the taste of my own imperfections.

She was born the next day at the dinner table. The egg cracked and then ceased to exist, shattered into infinitesimally small bits by a dragonfly of jade and gold. She buzzed contentedly as I held her in my arms, admiring the circuitry in her wings. I crooned to her to let her know that I was there. She brought her head to meet mine. We connected, man and beyond-man. I kissed her, savoring Complex mouthparts, dexterous legs, Lithe exoskeleton, slender antennae, Deep eyes, lofty wings, A scent of perfection to which I could only dream to aspire.

Just me and her now, man and beyond-man. What was she seeing, thinking in that body beyond my mere comprehension? The cybernetic capsule within her head, seat of her human emotions, that last Vestige of imperfection in a body that was above my own. How could I love her any less knowing that she was destined to surpass me. But for now, us together sharing the jointed metamorphosis of this body of hers, more beautiful than before, a soft, wet, warm thorax, wings ripe with the scent of ambition, A mind built to perceive, A soul meant to dream, A body created to achieve, A destiny within the stars.

She left me the way she entered in a flash that changed my life. I ate her and took her capsule, Seat of her mind, Seat of her emotions, Seat of her previous imperfection. Why did I eat her? What dream did I have that I would seek to ruin hers? Does she realize what has happened? Is this a nightmare? This impulse to consume, This horrific imperfection, How do I save her from myself, Join her in the capsule, connect to her mind, Uploaded to her world. She tasted of everything I wanted to be.

Stars. a platform. the sea. Just us. her imperfect body. the one we shared. What can I tell her?

In the article "Driverless Cars Are Coming," the author discusses both positive and negative aspects of driverless cars, but the negative aspects are more prominent. For instance, as mentioned by the author, "Radar was a device on a hilltop that cost two hundred million dollars." Investing millions of dollars in driverless technology may not prove to be a wise financial decision in the long run.

Despite being labeled as driverless, these vehicles still require human involvement. The notion of sitting passively in a car that intermittently demands your attention can be tedious and defeat the purpose of autonomous driving features. As per the author's statement, "They can steer, accelerate, and brake themselves but all are designed to notify the driver when human skills are necessary," indicating that full autonomy is not yet achieved.

印度一名男子近日租用了一块无人问津的荒地，在开垦过程中意外发现一颗价值连城的钻石，瞬间成为千万富翁。这段“挖掘奇迹”的故事，不仅展现了生活的戏剧性，也让人对潘纳地区（Panna）的钻石传奇更加津津乐道。

### 意外的转折：一颗钻石改变命运
根据《印度时报》报道，这位45岁的男子名叫拉克汉·亚达夫（Lakhan Yadav），他原本住在印度中央邦潘纳国家公园（Panna National Park）附近的一个小村庄。由于村庄被拆除，拉克汉从政府那里获得了一笔补偿金。为了贴补家用，他在上个月以200卢比（约新台币76元）的价格租用了一块2公顷的荒地和两头水牛，计划种植一些作物以维持生活。

然而，命运对他的馈赠远不止于此。在耕地的过程中，他突然发现一颗形状奇特的石头。出于好奇，他擦去石头上的泥土和灰尘，发现它竟然开始闪闪发光。随即，他将这颗石头送到专家手中鉴定，结果发现这是一颗重达14.98克拉的钻石。这枚钻石随后在12月5日拍卖，以6060万卢比（约新台币2300万元）的高价售出，令拉克汉的生活彻底改写。

### 朴实的梦想：教育基金与未来希望
在接受媒体采访时，拉克汉坦言，他从小家境清贫，没有接受过高等教育。因此，这笔巨款将用于存入银行，为他四个孩子的教育提供保障。他朴素而实用的想法展现了一位父亲的责任感和对孩子未来的殷切期望。

辛苦！养乐多妈妈照顾两名患罕见疾病女儿 不敢入睡

2019-04-28 17:32 联合报 记者 王敏旭 / 即时报导

新北市中和区的许心柔在婚后不仅要照顾公婆和丈夫，还要面对两名女儿被诊断出患有大拇指症候群的罕见疾病。每天，她不遗余力地照顾家人，深夜不敢入睡以便随时为女儿更换呼吸器。白天，她则骑着摩托车为客户送养乐多。她常说，不知道明天会怎样，所以把握当下最重要。

新北市社会局在母亲节前夕于市府大礼堂举办2019年模范母亲表扬活动。各区与局处单位推荐了模范妈妈接受表彰，许心柔带着两名女儿和丈夫等全家出席，接受了市长侯友宜的表扬。

43岁的许心柔婚后面临公公生意失败和中风，不得不承担起家庭照顾者的角色。大女儿出生后出现成长缓慢，历经多次手术和住院。相隔10年，她的二女儿出生，但也出现与大女儿相同的状况。经过医生诊断，确诊为大拇指症候群。

除了照顾两个女儿，许心柔的丈夫也患有抑郁症。她表示，女儿们患的是遗传性疾病，生长发育缓慢。姐姐能够接受教育并书写，妹妹则擅长生活自理，两姐妹的情况有所不同。丈夫虽然有工作，但身体状况不佳，所幸公司都能体谅。

许心柔一肩挑起家庭责任，成为一名“养乐多妈妈”。

Fires were occurring everywhere, from the ground to the sky above. Buildings crumbled, bricks and stone crashing hard on the ground. Cracks emerged on the Earth and spread open, showing never-ending voids. The air filled with smoke. People screamed in terror. As I watched the world come completely to its end, I remained frozen.

Suddenly, the scenery changed. One minute, I watched as the Earth tore itself apart. The next minute, I was looking up at my Mom's face. She smiled and made silly noises at me. I felt completely safe. I was away from the horror and destruction. I was also seventeen years younger. My vision was blurry. I felt as if I was reliving a memory. But this wasn't my memory. My mom died during my birth. I only knew of her from what my Dad and Grandparents had told me. My Mom never got to smile at me. She never got to take care of me. *Why was my mind doing this to me? What was the point?*

Then, there was a flash. In an instant, I found myself as a child sitting on the bus, heading to boarding school for the first time. I looked out the window at Mom and Dad. They waved goodbye as they held hands. I waved back as tears streamed down my face. I felt scared because I was going away to a place where I knew no one. I never went to boarding school. Dad didn't have enough money to send me to such a place. I went to the public school right by my house. I got to stay with my Dad and see him every day. *Also, why was my mind putting my Mom in the picture again?*

Another flash occurred. I was now in eighth grade. I'd just gotten done practicing a routine with the cheerleading squad. After practice, I said goodbye to a bunch of people as I left to go home. They said goodbye back, smiling broadly at me as they said, “See you tomorrow.” Yet, I was never a cheerleader. Nor was I popular in school. I always kept to myself, reading my comics and playing video games. I was a nerd who only had a couple of friends. Venus is actually a planet in our solar system, the second closest to the sun. It is often referred to as the "evening star" because it emits a bright light in the night sky. Venus is similar in size to Earth and is occasionally in close proximity to our planet.

Venus and Mars are two other planets in our solar system that orbit the sun at different speeds. Venus is always nearby in the vastness of space. The planet has a surface covered by about 97% carbon dioxide, leading to extreme temperatures exceeding 800 degrees and atmospheric pressure 90 times greater than that on Earth.

Venus has a rocky surface with features such as valleys, mountains, and craters, which are the result of long-term geological processes or the impact of space debris. The surface of the planet is distinct and fascinating to scientists and space travelers alike.

"Kill one person every year and I'm immortal?"

"That's the premise, you want in?"

"Does it matter how? Or is it more like as long as I had a hand in it."

"Doesn't matter."

"Even if by accident?"

"Death is death."

"OK, I'll do it."

845 years later, I was still grappling with the decision I had made. The deal seemed simple, but its execution was anything but. I had already killed 845 people, give or take a few. I always tried to keep the deaths to a minimum, only taking more than one life if I was sloppy and got caught. The first few years were the hardest. I cried for days after witnessing the life leave their eyes. Yet, by the sixth year, I awoke the next day and went about my business as though nothing had happened. Killing had become a habit.

As time went by, I moved every few decades. The change of scenery was not only necessary but also a welcome distraction from the graves I left behind. I always chose older individuals, preferably those with ailments or inoperable issues. It was never easy, but I knew it had to be done. I never dared to test the god's power by failing to kill—it seemed foolish when the arrangement had worked for so long.

A few decades ago, extending my life became more challenging. Scientists discovered a way to stop a deadly disease known as HIW, which affected less than 1% of the human population. It was more contagious than HIV and twice as lethal, with survivors living bedridden lives. Scientists mass-produced antibodies to halt its spread, and people eagerly lined up for their shots. But something went horribly wrong. The antibodies took over, rendering people useless and turning them into mere vessels. Almost 75% of the world's population was affected.

With a dwindling pool of 2.5 billion people, extending my life became increasingly difficult. Reproduction rates plummeted due to evolutionary changes and population constraints. The world wasn't repopulating as fast, and eventually, only 4 or 5 newborns appeared each year. People knew who I was—they knew I wouldn't die unless I failed to kill. They fled and hid, while some brave souls confronted me. None succeeded in harming me, thanks to centuries of experience with every weapon imaginable.

But I realized my time was running out. I found myself facing the last person alive on this planet, a young girl no older than 25. I thought back to the day I made the deal, one of the few memories that remained clear. I had used the god's power to its fullest, becoming a feared monster. Yet here she was, simply staring at me. I couldn't bring myself to harm her. We sat together, and I shared my story. For an entire year, I recounted what life was like 2 billion years ago, explaining my actions and motivations. We fell in love, drifted apart, and fell back in love again. As the minutes turned to seconds, I knew my choice: I would rather die than take the last life on this lifeless planet, in the arms of the last woman I'd love.

Jake Mangle-Wurzel, Huddersfield's premier eccentric, is preparing to mark 40 years of making people smile and upsetting them, while also celebrating his 80th birthday in May. Living in a caravan at Salendine Nook, Jake is immersed in writing his autobiography titled The Making of Mangle-Wurzel. He aims for the book to be a candid portrayal of his life, encompassing his struggles with depression and encounters with the law.

Born John Gray, Jake adopted the name Jake Mangle-Wurzel in 1978 after battling depression and thoughts of suicide. He reflects on his life's journey from despair to transformation, defining himself as the remarkable Wurzel. His narrative will delve into his past, including his family history, military service, career, relationships, and personal growth.

Despite his unconventional persona, Jake claims that he did not possess a sense of humor until he embraced his alter ego. His autobiography will also delve into his tumultuous relationships, including seven marriages, and his affinity for dogs over humans. With a deep-rooted aversion to societal norms and a penchant for authenticity, Jake's candid account is poised to shake things up and push boundaries.

As he progresses with his autobiography, Jake remains steadfast in his resolve to share his unfiltered truth, regardless of potential repercussions. His fearless attitude towards authority figures and his resilient spirit through adversities underscore his unwavering optimism. Despite setbacks such as house fires and personal losses, Jake exudes a sense of joy, hope, and resilience that characterizes his unique perspective on life.

Looking ahead, Jake envisions his autobiography becoming a bestseller and eventually a major motion picture. His unwavering belief in his story's impact and his willingness to challenge societal norms encapsulate the essence of Jake Mangle-Wurzel—the enduring, enigmatic figure who continues to captivate audiences with his eccentricity and resilience.

Hasta el momento, la Guardia Civil ha acreditado que los gastos totales comprometidos en el referéndum ilegal del pasado 1 de octubre en Cataluña ascienden a 1.932.765,42 euros. La mayoría de estos gastos corresponden al Govern, mientras que una pequeña parte fue asumida por Junts pel Sí.

Según se ha especificado en uno de los últimos informes presentados en el Tribunal Supremo, el gobierno catalán utilizó a Omnium para encargar la cartelería del 1-O con el logo de la Generalitat.

A continuación se detallan los gastos:

- Coste de Publicidad en medios: 502.639,61 euros (publicidad TV3, anuncio Vías y otros, 277.804 euros y Campaña "SI o NO", 224.835,25 euros).
- Servicios de Unipost (envíos): 980.313,76 euros (cinco facturas: departamento de Cultura, 196.696,98; vicepresidencia, 193.889,98; Salud, 192.711,20; Trabajo, 197.492,04 y Presidencia, 198.871,76).
- Carteles encargados por Omnium con el logo de la Generalitat: 61.879 euros.
- Coste de los observadores: 217.656,22 euros (dos pagos realizados ya por 119.700 euros; un pago final de 47.365 y Vuelos, hoteles y actos por 40.591,22).
- Alquiler Teatro Nacional de Cataluña: 17.698,20 euros.
- Material electoral intervenido: 152.578,63 euros (material intervenido en Igualada, 60.369,60 euros y Material de Bigues i Riels, 92.209,03).

Estos gastos suman un total de 1.932.765,42 euros. Sin embargo, el informe no establece cuántos gastos comprometidos han sido abonados realmente y cuántos no. Se precisa que se ha acreditado que la Generalitat pagó 119.700 euros a la empresa The Hague Center for Strategic Studies por el desplazamiento de observadores internacionales para el 1 de octubre.

No obstante, se añade que también había un compromiso de pago de otros 47.365 euros que sería un "pago final" a realizarse en noviembre pasado, pero se desconoce si esa factura se abonó o no. Se han solicitado mandamientos que aún no se han llevado a cabo en las diligencias de investigación de la presunta malversación de fondos públicos por parte del Diplocat.

La Guardia Civil también informa que ha habido dos intentos de cobrar una de las cinco facturas en las que se dividió el pago a Unipost. Se trata de una factura de 238.965,37 euros que la citada empresa tenía confeccionada para el Departamento de Trabajo, Asuntos Sociales y Familia de la Generalitat.

北韩（朝鲜）在10日劳动党第8次全国大会时，拥戴最高领导人金正恩为劳动党总书记。然而，其胞妹、劳动党第一副部长金与正原本身居政治局候补委员，却在此次大会中未能进入委员名单，甚至连候补委员名单也未入列。南韩情报当局先前预测金与正今年可能进入核心决策圈的说法因此遭到推翻，显示她目前处于「失宠」状态。

根据《韩联社》、《朝鲜日报》的报道，金与正近年的崛起引人注目。2018年2月，她前往南韩参加平昌冬季奥运，与南韩总统文在寅、第一夫人金正淑一同观赛，开始受到国际瞩目。同年4、5、9月，她在南北韩元首峰会时随侍金正恩在侧，留下深刻印象。2019年，金与正担任第一副部长，开始主导对南韩的外交事务，并于去年4月成为政治局候补委员。

然而，金与正过去一年在对南韩、对美国的外交表现未能让金正恩满意，认为不及其心腹赵甬元（조용원）。去年6月，金与正对南韩境内脱北者团体施放反体制传单气球一事表现出极大愤怒，指示断绝两韩通讯往来，甚至炸毁开城工业区的两韩联合办事处，展示了其在对南韩施压上的强硬态度。7月，她以自身名义否决再次召开川金会的可能性，并要求美方提供美国独立纪念日的DVD。

不仅如此，在金正恩前往外地或灾区视察时，金与正多次出现在官方公开的相片中，展现了她在外交、国防、内政方面的独特影响力。去年8月，南韩国家情报院在某场质询时承认，有迹象显示金与正已获委托掌管国政，以分散金正恩的统治压力。然而，这些迹象并未使她获得更高的党内职责。

南韩庆南大学远东问题研究所教授林乙出（임을출）分析，金正恩可能认为金与正未能展现出足够的成果。

I run out the door of the lottery office with the paper in hand. Cold sweat covers my brow as I dive into the truck and my partner takes off. We left no trace; painstaking attention made sure of that. We're going to be rich.

Le 24 octobre 2018, Ali Bongo Ondimba a été victime d'un accident vasculaire cérébral (AVC) lors d'un séjour en Arabie saoudite. Après plusieurs mois d'hospitalisation, il est rentré. Cependant, est-il toujours en charge ?

L'absence prolongée du président gabonais a initialement plongé le pays dans l'incertitude. Les informations sur son état de santé étaient alarmantes.

Selon Franck Ndjimbi, membre du collectif "Appel à agir" au Gabon, cette situation a entraîné une "usurpation du pouvoir en violation de la Constitution". Le collectif demande une expertise médicale pour évaluer la capacité physique et mentale du président à gouverner le pays.

"L'essentiel du pouvoir politique est entre les mains de personnes non prévues par la Constitution, comme le Directeur de cabinet du président Ali Bongo Ondimba, Brice Laccruche Alihanga. Il peut être assimilé à un fonctionnaire de la Présidence, sans mandat populaire. Les institutions semblent paralysées face à cette imposture qui s'ajoute à une usurpation de pouvoir existante", souligne-t-il.

Guerre des clans

Certains analystes estiment que la longue convalescence du président a entraîné une lutte de pouvoir au sein du régime. Arsel Moro Ngui et d'autres sources confirment cette situation.

"Le rétablissement physique du président n'a pas dissipé les doutes sur sa capacité réelle à prendre des décisions", affirme Arsel Moro Ngui. "Le clan dirigé par l'épouse du président et le directeur de cabinet semble détenir le pouvoir actuellement", ajoute-t-il, professeur de sciences politiques à l'université Omar Bongo Ondimba de Libreville.

Jusqu'au bout

Le porte-parole d'Ali Bongo Ondimba avait accepté une interview sur le sujet, mais Ike Ngouoni n'a pas répondu aux multiples appels de la DW.

Le président gabonais a déclaré dans une interview au quotidien pro-gouvernemental l'Union qu'il "se sentait de mieux en mieux chaque jour" et était "déterminé à aller jusqu'au bout de sa mission".

En dressant le bilan de ses dix ans à la tête du Gabon, le président a souligné la diversification de l'économie engagée dès 2010, qui "commence à porter ses fruits". Il a également mis l'accent sur la lutte contre la corruption, affirmant sa détermination à la poursuivre.

Malgré une croissance prévue de 3,4% cette année au Gabon selon un récent rapport international, le pays manque toujours d'infrastructures telles que routes, écoles ou hôpitaux.

Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) enables round-the-clock, all-weather observation of the Earth by using the synthetic aperture principle to achieve high-resolution microwave imaging. Accurately and swiftly classifying ships in SAR images is crucial for executing certain sea surface missions. However, SAR ship classification using data-driven deep learning faces a more significant challenge of overfitting compared to optical images, primarily due to the limited availability of SAR ship data and the presence of noise.

With the rapid advancement of deep learning in image processing, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) have become increasingly popular in the field of SAR ship classification. However, the complexity of CNN models can introduce redundant features, further increasing the risk of overfitting. Knowledge distillation (KD), which transfers knowledge from a cumbersome pre-trained teacher model to a lightweight student model, has been widely utilized in various SAR tasks. These works inherit the concept of knowledge transfer from traditional KD. Recently, it has been suggested that the success of KD can be attributed to the regularization effect of the soft labels provided by the teacher model, from the perspective of label smoothing regularization (LSR). This highlights the significant potential of applying KD in the field of regularization.

To enhance the generalization of SAR ship classification, this paper introduces the Double Reverse Regularization Network, which incorporates both online and offline distillation. As illustrated in Figure 1, the network controls the reverse adjustment of the offline and online distillation weights, effectively utilizing the knowledge of both the teacher and the student.

The Director-General of the Ghana Education Service (GES), Prof. Kwasi Opoku-Amankwa, has emphasized the importance of maintaining professionalism among teachers by upholding the teacher licensure examination. During a visit to the Accra College of Education, which was hosting the Ghana Teacher Licensure Examination, he expressed concerns about the implications of reversing the progress made in aligning Ghanaian teachers with international standards.

The examination, originally scheduled for September 24 and 25, 2020, had to be rescheduled to October 1 and 2, 2020, due to changes in the academic calendar caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. A total of 31,167 newly trained teachers are participating in this two-day examination, covering topics such as Literacy, Essential Professional Skills, and Numeracy.

Prof. Opoku-Amankwa highlighted that professionalism in teaching is crucial for ensuring the quality of education in Ghana. He explained that licensing teachers and providing continuous professional development opportunities are integral components of enhancing the professionalism and effectiveness of educators.

The Director-General cited examples of other professions such as medical practitioners, lawyers, and architects, where licensing and adherence to a code of ethics are standard practice. He pointed out that countries like the United Kingdom and South Africa have already implemented teacher licensing systems to raise educational standards.

Prof. Opoku-Amankwa underscored the government's commitment to supporting teachers through initiatives like the provision of a professional development allowance and continuous professional development courses.

Astronomers are particularly fascinated by Venus because it may have once been the most Earth-like planet in our solar system. NASA is actively developing new methods to study Venus. For instance, simplified electronics made of silicon carbide have been tested in a chamber that simulates the extreme conditions of Venus's surface and have survived for three weeks. In comparison, systems that use mechanical parts can be designed to be more resistant to pressure, heat, and other forces. This evidence demonstrates that NASA is exploring various approaches and developing new technologies to withstand Venus's harsh conditions.

The first image that made the natural landform on Mars look like a face had low resolution compared to the subsequent images. The original Viking image had very low resolution compared to the ones taken in 1998 and 2001. Michel Malin and his MOC team took photos that were ten times clearer than the original Viking photos.

The later images taken after the original Viking image were clear enough and enlarged enough to see any type of building or structure, but none were seen. There were 1.56 meters per pixel in the original image, but in the 2001 image, there was 43 meters per pixel. Some conspiracy theorists thought that NASA hid some alien markings, but NASA did not hide anything. It is clear in the photos taken after the original Viking photo.

If there were some sort of life form on Mars, NASA would get more funding. They were getting everyone's attention and making everyone wonder if there was some sort of alien life form on Mars that could have created the "face." They would have received a significant amount of money to investigate what was on Mars.

If there were any structures built on Mars, they would be visible due to the size and resolution of the images. There is no reason for NASA to lie about there being no alien life form on Mars. Llusar, empresa castellonense especializada en la producción y comercialización de cítricos, ha anunciado la compra del 100% de Naranjas Torres. Esta operación se enmarca dentro del plan de consolidación nacional e internacional de Llusar y de crecimiento tanto orgánico como inorgánico que la compañía comenzó a principios de 2021 tras la incorporación de MCH Private Equity y SanLucar Fruit a su accionariado.

La operación, cuyas cifras no han trascendido, creará uno de los principales grupos industriales citrícolas del país, especializado en los productos premium y de marca. La facturación conjunta de esta nueva compañía fusionada será de 130 millones y su ebitda de 18 millones. Además, alcanzará alrededor de 100.000 toneladas de fruta comercializadas al año, producidas en más de 45.000 metros cuadrados de instalaciones divididas entre Almenara y Chilches (Castellón).

Aunque ambas compañías seguirán operando de manera independiente, la operación persigue el principal objetivo de generar importantes sinergias, sobre todo logísticas y productivas. Con este fin, el equipo directivo ya está diseñando un nuevo plan estratégico para maximizar estas sinergias. Llusar se centra en la exportación de mandarinas, mientras que Naranjas Torres se enfoca en la comercialización de naranjas con marca en España y también de mandarinas.

En cuanto a los asesores, Norgestión ha asesorado a Llusar en la operación de M&A, Anaford en aspectos legales y Deloitte en el ámbito financiero. Por parte de la parte vendedora, Martí Solá y Quáter han brindado asesoramiento en aspectos legales y de M&A.

قام اللواء عبد الحميد الهجان، محافظ القليوبية، صباح اليوم الخميس، بزيارة عدد من المشروعات في مدينتي كفر شكر وشبرا الخيمة. بدأت الجولة بزيارة مستشفى كفر شكر المركزي لمتابعة الاستعدادات النهائية للتشغيل التجريبي واستقبال مرضى كورونا. تم تجهيز المستشفى بالأجهزة الطبية اللازمة وحل جميع المشاكل التي كانت تعوق التشغيل، بما في ذلك معالجة تسريب المياه وتوفير حصة أكسجين دائمة.

في بيان له اليوم، أكد محافظ القليوبية بدء التشغيل التجريبي لاستقبال مرضى ومصابي كورونا في المستشفى. كما أشار إلى تخصيص غرف عزل لهم وأن المستشفى سيكون مركزًا لتلقي لقاح كورونا لخدمة مرضى المحافظة والمحافظات المجاورة.

وجه المحافظ بأهمية النظافة والتطهير المستمر في المستشفى، بالإضافة إلى تقديم الخدمات والرعاية الصحية للمرضى. يتناول البيان أيضًا مشروعات إحلال وتجديد المستشفيات في محافظة القليوبية، بتكلفة إجمالية تصل إلى 1.091 مليار جنيه.

تابع اللواء الجولة بزيارة محطة مرشحة في قرية المنشأة الكبرى بكفر شكر، والتي ستخدم نحو 225 ألف نسمة من أهالي المنطقة. شدد المحافظ على أهمية الالتزام بالتوقيتات المحددة للإنتهاء من أعمال المحطة ودخولها الخدمة في أسرع وقت.

في ختام الزيارة، توجه المحافظ لحي شرق شبرا الخيمة لمتابعة أعمال إنشاء مشتل على ترعة الإسماعيلية بمساحة 1200 متر مربع. تم رفع أكثر من 1500 طن من القمامة ومخلفات المباني، وذلك ضمن جهود لتحسين البيئة وتوفير جو صحي لسكان المنطقة.

حضر الجولة عدد من الشخصيات الهامة مثل نائب المحافظ ورؤساء المدن وممثلين عن الصحة وشركة مياه الشرب والصرف الصحي.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, the Uttarakhand government on Tuesday made it mandatory for people coming from a dozen states to furnish negative RT-PCR test reports not older than 72 hours on arrival. Persons above 65 years of age, those with co-morbidities, pregnant women, and children below 10 are advised to travel only in unavoidable circumstances, the advisory said.

The district administration shall make arrangements for random COVID-19 testing at the airport, railway stations, and all border check posts, it added. If any inbound person is found positive for COVID-19, prevailing standard operating procedure shall be followed for further care, the advisory said.

Along with this, the February 26 order regarding the "SOP for prevention and control of COVID-19 during the Maha Kumbh Mela 2021 at Haridwar" shall be strictly followed, the official added. SANTO DOMINGO.- BPC Banking Technologies, una organización que conecta las necesidades de la vida real de las personas con soluciones digitales inteligentes, ha identificado las tendencias de pago que se consolidarán en la región, representando una oportunidad para la industria financiera, según la agencia.

Según BPC Banking Technologies, estas serán las cinco tendencias de pago que se impondrán el próximo año:

1. **Las SuperApps:** Son aplicaciones móviles que integran diversas ofertas y servicios digitales en un solo lugar, permitiendo a los usuarios resolver sus necesidades de manera integral. Rappi es el gran exponente en la región, presente en nueve países de América Latina y más de 250 ciudades. “Este tipo de desarrollos son muy populares en mercados como el asiático y han transformado la vida cotidiana y financiera de cientos de miles de personas. Esta tendencia permite realizar actividades bancarias, acceder al comercio electrónico, transporte, pago de cuentas, entre otros servicios. Su aporte más relevante es que construyen relaciones significativas con los consumidores, impulsándolos a utilizar la solución en su vida diaria gracias a los beneficios directos que encuentran al usarlas”, comenta Mariflor Alice, directora regional de pagos de BPC Banking Technologies.

2. **Pagos con Código QR:** Esta modalidad seguirá en aumento. Según BPC, el 78% de los usuarios prefieren evitar el dinero en efectivo en un mundo postpandémico. La adopción de transacciones con esta tecnología continuará creciendo y evolucionará significativamente en la región.

3. **Pagos Peer-to-Peer (P2P):** En el próximo año se verá una mayor adopción de este concepto, el cual permite la transferencia de fondos entre dos personas desde sus cuentas bancarias a través de una aplicación o línea móvil. Esto facilita el envío de remesas y la división de facturas y cuentas con amigos y familiares de manera rápida y sencilla.

4. **Tarjetas de prepago virtuales:** Estas tarjetas, que son la versión electrónica de las tarjetas bancarias físicas, han ganado popularidad debido a su facilidad de uso y seguridad, ya que utilizan un número distinto para proteger la información del usuario, evitando riesgos y permitiendo pagos sin contacto. Según la investigación de Edgar, Dunn & Company, el mercado global de tarjetas prepagas alcanzará los 3.7 billones de dólares el próximo año. “Su implementación ofrece una alternativa al uso del efectivo, y el cambio de tarjetas físicas a modelos prepagos virtuales representa un avance en términos de experiencia y seguridad para el cliente”, añade la representante de BPC Banking Technologies.

5. **Billeteras virtuales:** Los monederos electrónicos seguirán promoviendo una sociedad sin efectivo, permitiendo realizar pagos en línea o en tiendas físicas de manera fácil e inmediata. En los mercados emergentes, estas billeteras ofrecen la oportunidad de empoderar a las personas, facilitando el acceso a servicios financieros.

As mathematical models of biological systems continue to advance, they are increasingly utilized in designing systems for specific purposes. A prime illustration of this is the development of custom networks of interacting biomolecules that function as logic gates (e.g., AND or OR) in response to varying input concentrations. These networks have a wide range of applications such as biosensors, targeted drug delivery, and tunable genetic circuits. However, due to discrepancies between mathematical predictions and biological actuality, each network must undergo experimental validation to ensure that it exhibits the desired response in the real world. The costs of these validation experiments can escalate significantly when dealing with numerous networks. In our study, we introduce a method to ascertain if the actual response of a network closely aligns with the desired outcome.

Previous validation of biomolecular networks [1, 4, 5] involved conducting experiments at specific predetermined input points deemed crucial for the intended application. The selection of these points aimed to ensure similarity between the experimental outcomes. A related yet distinct issue is explored in the realm of surrogate modeling literature, where understanding the disparity between experimental data and a true reference is paramount [6, 7, 8, 9]. Drawing inspiration from these methods, we (1) model the disparity so that observed data guides our prediction of the overall discrepancy and (2) use this model to intelligently determine the next experiment to conduct. In our approach, after each data acquisition, a Gaussian process is fitted to the disparity between the experimental results and the computer model.

Publié le 12/09/2019 à 19h47, quatre personnes ont été interpellées par la police dans un campement regroupant environ 350 migrants, situé dans un parc du nord-est de Rennes. Ces interpellations ont eu lieu pendant un contrôle d'identité mené par les forces de l'ordre, comme l'a rapporté la préfecture d'Ille-et-Vilaine.

Le contrôle, réalisé sur réquisition du procureur, visait à recueillir l'identité de tous les occupants, certains étant présents depuis mi-juillet, dans deux clairières du parc des Gayeulles, au nord-est de Rennes. "L'objectif est d'avoir une vision claire, exhaustive et précise de toutes les situations individuelles", a déclaré la préfecture à l'AFP.

Parmi les migrants se trouvent de nombreux Géorgiens et Albanais, ainsi qu'une cinquantaine d'enfants. Selon la préfecture, le contrôle s'est déroulé "sans incident et sur une base déclarative. En fonction de cet examen, nous déciderons de la prise en charge ou non des 1 500 places disponibles, car l'État accueille les demandeurs d'asile et les réfugiés", a-t-elle précisé, ajoutant que "l'opération a révélé la présence de quatre étrangers en situation irrégulière, qui ont été conduits dans les locaux de la police aux frontières en vue d'une procédure d'éloignement".

Plusieurs associations ont exprimé leur opposition à ces interpellations. Ces associations font partie de l'"inter-organisation de soutien aux personnes exilées de Rennes". La semaine dernière, elles avaient transmis une liste d'une soixantaine de personnes concernées par une procédure d'asile, se disant "choquées" par la méthode employée.

"Nous sommes profondément choqués par cette réaction, nous ne nous y attendions pas. Nous demandons à l'État de mettre à l'abri les personnes vulnérables, les réfugiés, et la réponse que nous obtenons est 'contrôle et répression', avec le déploiement d'un important dispositif policier sous prétexte de recenser les personnes", a réagi Carole Bohanne, présidente du MRAP 35 (Mouvement contre le racisme et pour l'amitié entre les peuples).

The deployment of Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS) within the US National Airspace has witnessed significant growth, driven by applications such as remote sensing, package delivery, and emergency response. These operations take place in airspace shared with other sUAS and are subject to restrictions like no-fly zones around airports, national parks, and schools. The increasing numbers of sUAS have led to a rise in reported incidents, often linked to issues such as hardware or software malfunctions, human errors (like disregard for rules and regulations), or external factors such as radio interference and adverse weather conditions. Consequently, sUAS operators are required to obtain permission to fly in controlled airspace. For instance, in the USA, Remote Pilots In Command (RPICs) need to seek flight authorization through the Low Altitude Authorization and Notification Capability (LAANC), allowing access to airspace below 400 feet above ground level (AGL), defining where RPICs can fly and providing air traffic controllers with visibility into ongoing sUAS operations. However, the current system does not account for specific flight details, environmental factors, drone characteristics, or pilot competencies.

To address these challenges, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), with research support from NASA, is developing a unified ecosystem known as the UAS Traffic Management System (UTM) to manage large numbers of sUAS in shared low-altitude airspace. The UTM system relies on digitally exchanging planned flight information for each RPIC. Factors influencing an sUAS's capability to perform a mission safely include its features (such as weight, size, and sensors), suitability for flight, operating environment, planned flight details, and the human operator's qualifications and skills. While still in development, the UTM will mandate operators to submit a Performance Authorization Request (PAR) outlining how their sUAS's assets, services, personnel, and maintenance protocols ensure safe operation. The software for the UTM is critical for airspace safety, as its decisions can impact airspace safety or compromise it, especially in safety-critical operations like rescue missions.

Evaluating PARs currently relies on manual processes, lacking scalability and being prone to human error. Automation is crucial for handling the anticipated volume of sUAS flight requests in populated airspaces efficiently. A fully automated flight authorization system could swiftly approve or deny most flight requests, potentially incorporating Machine Learning (ML) for scalability as data accumulates over time. However, the opacity of ML-based systems raises concerns about algorithmic fairness and transparency in automated flight authorizations.

Due to limited available data, the challenge exists in training an unbiased initial system for automated decision-making within the UTM framework. Nevertheless, this presents an opportunity to construct a system from scratch that integrates fairness and transparency considerations early on. Understanding the factors crucial to UTM stakeholders is vital for developing a fair and transparent automated flight authorization system.

His eyes snapped open, and he sat up with a jolt, an inexplicable instinct prompting him. He glanced around in confusion. He had no idea where he was. It looked like his room, yet it didn’t. Gone were the bare white walls and the usual mess of gaming consoles, controllers, and tangled wires. Instead, a softer scene greeted him—surprisingly familiar. The gentle rustling of leaves outside mingled with shafts of golden light filtering through the open blinds, casting a glow on the flowered wallpaper that adorned the walls. His childhood home, it had to be. The wallpaper was unique; his mother had painted it herself. Vague yet fond memories surfaced of watching her cheerfully paint each flower when he was just a child. Those were better times, before the non-fatal yet debilitating illnesses struck his parents and the subsequent financial struggles ensued.

He slowly stood up, feeling the plush carpet beneath his feet and wiggling his toes to savor its softness. After a quick glance around to appreciate the room's beauty, he approached the window, lifting the blinds to look outside. He shielded his eyes from the early morning sun, its golden glow spilling over the familiar suburban neighborhood. A part of him wanted to wake himself up, to ensure this was only a dream. Another part wanted to manipulate the dream, while yet another warned him of its vividness. But he dismissed these thoughts, overwhelmed by the serene beauty around him. He felt an unparalleled sense of inner peace and happiness.

He slipped on a pair of pajama pants and a large, soft shirt—just how he liked them. The door opened smoothly, unlike the squeaky, stuck doors of their current house. For a moment, he wondered if the dream had gone silent. But as he stepped into the hallway, the soft thud of his feet on the carpet, warmed by the vents beneath, and the muted sounds of a Harry Potter movie reassured him. West Coast premiership big man Nathan Vardy seems to have secured the spot as Nic Naitanui's ruck partner for round one of the AFL season. Naitanui made a successful return to the field in the pre-season match against Fremantle, recording 22 hit-outs from five possessions before coming off in the third quarter. This game was crucial for Naitanui, as it was his only match of the pre-season following a hamstring injury over the summer.

Given the return to full-length matches this year, West Coast is looking to provide more support for Naitanui in the ruck. Vardy, who didn't play in the AFL last year due to a serious leg condition, appears to be the likely choice to support Naitanui. With Bailey Williams nursing an ankle injury, Vardy's strong performance in the pre-season games puts him in a good position for a round-one call-up against Gold Coast.

In terms of Oscar Allen, his role in the team for the upcoming season remains uncertain. Allen was the primary ruck support for Naitanui last year, but the Eagles are considering using a recognized ruckman like Vardy or Williams in that role in 2021. Coach Adam Simpson mentioned that Allen has been versatile during the pre-season, alternating between roles in attack and defense. With the potential return of Josh Kennedy for round one, Allen may see more playing time in defense.

The Eagles are dealing with several injury concerns as they approach the start of the season. Star midfielder Tim Kelly missed both pre-season games due to a thumb injury but is expected to be fit for round one. Captain Luke Shuey sustained an ankle injury in the match against Fremantle but is likely to be available for the season opener. On the other hand, recruit Zac Langdon suffered a serious concussion and is unlikely to be selected for round one.

Furthermore, onballer Elliot Yeo will be sidelined at the beginning of the season due to ongoing issues with osteitis pubis. Although there are options to consider, such as defender Harry Edwards, the Eagles are leaning towards a more traditional ruck setup for round one. With uncertainties surrounding the roles of players like Allen and Vardy, West Coast will continue to assess their options leading up to the start of the AFL season.

近年来，零工经济（gig economy）在全球范围内兴起，台湾也不例外。满街可见的外送员便是其中最明显的例证。在讨论零工经济之前，有必要先明确其定义。所谓零工经济，指的是由一群全职或兼职的自由工作者构建的经济领域。这种经济形式以工作量较少、工时灵活、不必遵循朝九晚五的工作模式为特征，相对传统的全职工作而言更为弹性。

传统的「打零工」指的是没有固定工作的情况下，通过短期或临时工作获取收入。这与当前的零工经济存在本质区别。零工经济的工作者可能同时拥有其他全职工作，而不仅限于短期工作。根据麦肯锡全球研究所（MGI）2016年的调查报告，零工经济的工作者被明确定义为一群拥有自主性、按件计酬、与客户保持短期合作关系的独立工作者，他们可能是全职或兼职。

统计数据显示，台湾目前大约有5万名外送平台的外送员，其中约70%的人将其作为正职工作。选择外送员作为正职的原因通常包括「就业环境恶化」、「传统工作薪资不高，外送员收入更高」以及「正职工作的工时与报酬不匹配」等。

实际上，零工经济是一种「非典型就业」或「非典型工作」形式，它反映了就业环境的恶化，如薪资停滞，使得从事低技术、低专业、高替代性工作的劳动者不得不通过零工经济来增加收入、改善生活质量，或者弥补失业带来的收入缺口。这与企业经营策略也有密切关系。例如，台湾的中小企业为节省正职营销人员的人力成本，倾向于将营销工作外包给独立工作室或独立工作者，按件计酬，以减少公司开支。这意味着企业可能裁减一些高替代性、重复性高的正职工作，选择将被认为「不值得聘用正职员工」的业务外包出去，导致典型就业机会的减少。

在零工经济下，工作者的劳动权益保障成为一个突出问题。如果我们将当前的就业市场想象为一个光谱，一端是典型就业和职业阶梯，另一端是失业，连接两端的便是具有替代性质的零工经济。那么，现在哪家餐厅还会聘请正职外送员呢？

从台湾的自由接案平台来看，确实存在不少高端、专业性强的接案工作。对于拥有技术和专业技能的工作者而言，这些机会不仅能增加收入，还能拓展人脉，为迈向更高层次提供契机。零工经济在这种情况下反而成为一种助力。

Dar es Salaam—President Samia Suluhu Hassan met with Africa’s richest man and Nigerian billionaire, Aliko Dangote, at State House on Monday, May 24. Following their discussions, Dangote, who has business interests across Africa including Tanzania, urged other businessmen to invest in the country, citing the conducive environment.

"The business landscape has transformed significantly, with opportunities emerging. Wherever I go, I will promote Tanzania as an investment destination and encourage others to consider investing here," Dangote stated.

With investments in Tanzania totaling $770 million USD (1.761 trillion shillings), primarily in cement manufacturing, Dangote expressed plans to establish a fertilizer factory in the country. He emphasized his commitment to further investments in Tanzania to foster job creation and economic growth.

President Samia commended Dangote for his contributions to the country and assured him of the government's support and protection for his investments. She directed key officials, including Minister of Trade and Investment Prof. Kitila Mkumbo, Minister of Investment Geoffrey Mwambe, and Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Hamad Masauni, to address any challenges facing Dangote's industry to ensure its continued production and success.

Traffic safety experts have tried various strategies to combat speeding, as speeding-related crashes claim around 12,000 American lives annually. Initially, they attempted flashing signs to alert drivers of their speed, believing that drivers would slow down if they were aware of their speed. When this method proved ineffective, they deployed law enforcement officers to deter speeding, emphasizing the deterrent effect of severe penalties for speeding violations. Subsequently, hidden speeding cameras were installed on major roads to encourage cautious driving by creating uncertainty about when drivers were being monitored.

The latest approach in the ongoing battle against speeding involves placing a GPS device inside cars to incentivize drivers to maintain safe speeds. Researchers have discovered that a GPS device that monitors a vehicle's speed relative to the posted speed limit, coupled with a financial incentive, effectively reduces speeding behavior. In a study supported by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, drivers were offered a $25 reward each week for safe driving, with penalties deducted for exceeding speed limits.

The experiment demonstrated significant reductions in speeding violations, particularly for drivers exceeding speed limits by nine or more miles per hour. The combination of rewards for safe driving and penalties for speeding violations proved highly effective in modifying driver behavior. The study revealed that some drivers even turned the incentive system into a personal challenge, further motivating them to comply with speed limits.

The success of this incentive-based approach suggests potential applications beyond research studies. Ian Reagan, a traffic safety researcher, envisions insurance companies offering similar tracking devices to policyholders interested in reducing their premiums. Unlike current rebate programs, these devices would provide real-time feedback to drivers, informing them of the financial implications of their driving behavior after each trip.

In conclusion, this innovative method of using incentives to promote safe driving behavior represents a promising advancement in traffic safety initiatives. By combining rewards and penalties, authorities aim to encourage drivers to adhere to speed limits and reduce the risk of speeding-related accidents. The evolving landscape of traffic safety strategies may soon see widespread adoption of such incentive-based programs by insurance companies and other stakeholders.

Dana's first thought was that there was too much water. Cold, turgid swamp water was draining from her nose and mouth. Her second thought was about how dark it had become. Hadn't it been mid-afternoon when the gator had... Oh God, the gator. Now she remembered. She recalled the sudden movement in the water along the trail she and Sarah had been hiking. She remembered Sarah's eyes widening, her mouth opening to scream or shout a warning. Dana never knew which it was. She recalled the pressure as those jaws clamped around her lower leg and the feeling of water filling her mouth and nose as she was dragged into the bayou. She looked down at her leg. Her jeans were torn, shredded really, and caked in mud, but her leg didn't hurt, didn't look hurt. Dana pulled herself out of the water and back onto the hiking trail. She stood and stretched, her joints popping, her muscles burning. She took a few moments to gather her thoughts and then set off slowly down the trail.

It was pitch black, and she jumped at every noise, but slowly and surely, she made her way back toward the trailhead. She knew that she and Sarah had only been four or five miles into the Bayou, so it shouldn't take more than a couple of hours to get back to where they had parked, even in the dark. It couldn't have been more than 15 minutes, however, when Dana spotted a light flickering through the trees. She hurried down the trail toward the light and discovered that it was coming from a single dim bulb mounted above the doorway of a small rest area building. Actually, calling it a rest area, or even a building, was pretty generous. Dana recalled that she and Sarah had passed through here on the hike in, not long before the attack. It was really just an old outhouse-type bathroom with only the one light on the outside and an old drinking fountain. Dana had filled her water bottle there earlier, and Sarah had called her crazy for drinking what she said was guaranteed to be swamp water. It had tasted fine to Dana. Actually, Dana thought, she could use some fresh water to wash the taste of swamp out of her mouth. She walked over to the fountain and depressed the lever, but no water came out. That struck her as odd because it had been working earlier, but she figured she just couldn't count on the reliability of swamp plumbing.

Dana took another few minutes to rest in the small lighted clearing. After digging through what was left of her bag and finding that whatever the gator hadn't eaten had been ruined by the water, she started back down the trail. Two horribly long and dark hours later, Dana found herself in the small dirt parking lot for the trailhead. Sarah's car was gone, which she should have expected. Sarah most likely thought she was dead and had gone to get help. Now that she was out of the swamp, Dana began to really think about what had happened.

Projected stochastic gradient descent (SGD) is a fundamental method used to address large-scale constrained single-level machine learning problems. To minimize E ξ [L(x; ξ)] within a given convex set X, the algorithm generates a sequence where x k+1 = Proj X (x k - α∇L(x k; ξ k)), with α > 0 representing the step size and ∇L(x k; ξ k) being a stochastic gradient estimate of E ξ L(x k; ξ). If E ξ [L(x; ξ)] is nonconvex, projected SGD requires a sample complexity of O(ε^-2) with a batch size of O(1/ε) [25]. The need for a batch size of O(1/ε) was later relaxed [14] using the Moreau envelope technique, with its convergence rate matching that of vanilla SGD.

In recent machine learning applications, the scope has expanded to include hyperparameter optimization [19, 47], meta-learning [18], reinforcement learning [56], and neural architecture search [40]. While the nonasymptotic analysis of the alternating implicit SGD for unconstrained bilevel optimization with strongly convex and smooth lower-level problems has been well-understood [8, 24, 29, 32, 37], there is a gap in knowledge regarding the finite-time guarantee of alternating implicit projected SGD for bilevel problems with both upper-level (UL) and lower-level (LL) constraints. This raises the crucial question: Can we establish the Õ(ε^-2) sample complexity of alternating implicit projected SGD for a family of bilevel problems with both UL and LL constraints?

We provide an affirmative answer to this question for stochastic bilevel optimization problems that feature both UL and LL constraints. These problems are defined as follows:

Standard crowdsourced benchmarks have played a crucial role in advancing natural language processing (NLP). However, recent studies (Gururangan et al., 2018; Poliak et al., 2018; Tsuchiya, 2018) have revealed the presence of exploitable annotation artifacts in these datasets. Models have been shown to leverage these artifacts to achieve top-notch performance on these benchmarks (McCoy et al., 2019; Naik et al., 2018). Consequently, the existence of these artifacts poses challenges in predicting out-of-domain generalization and raises doubts about the tasks' intended evaluations.

In response to these concerns, researchers have started exploring the use of counterfactually-augmented datasets to mitigate annotation artifacts and enhance the robustness of classifiers (Kaushik et al., 2020; Khashabi et al., 2020). These datasets are constructed by initially selecting a set of seed examples, followed by creating new examples through minimal alterations to produce counterfactual labels. This data collection method has proven effective in reducing artifacts in SNLI (Bowman et al., 2015), offering a way to pinpoint critical differences (Kaushik et al., 2020). Additionally, Khashabi et al. (2020) propose this method as an efficient approach to gather training data that leads to models better equipped to handle variations and generalize effectively.

However, findings indicate that unaugmented datasets may outperform datasets with a 50-50 mix of original and augmented data when considering training set size and annotation costs.

In our study, we delve deeper into the impact of training models on counterfactually-augmented data obtained through standard crowdsourcing methods, focusing on natural language inference (NLI) - the task of deducing the truth of a hypothesis based on a true premise. We train and compare RoBERTa (Liu et al., 2019) on three datasets: (1) the counterfactually-augmented natural language inference (CNLI) training set comprising 8.3k seed and augmented SNLI examples from Kaushik et al. (2020), (2) a subsampled set of 8.3k unaugmented SNLI examples to ensure size consistency, and (3) the 1.7k CNLI seed examples originally sourced from SNLI. We then evaluate model performances on MNLI (Williams et al., 2018), which features out-of-domain examples compared to SNLI, and two diagnostic sets (Naik et al., 2018; Wang et al., 2019a).

Our results show that RoBERTa trained on CNLI demonstrates similar performance on out-of-domain MNLI examples compared to the unaugmented subsampled SNLI training set. Moreover, adding counterfactually-augmented examples to the CNLI seed set enhances generalization. The performance boost over seed examples is attributed to an increase in n-grams, with the addition of augmented examples approximately doubling the number of 4-grams, potentially resulting from enhanced lexical diversity in a larger training set. While consistent trends are observed in most diagnostic evaluations, we also identify instances where training solely on seed examples outperforms including augmented examples.

Although there are advantages to employing this data type for model evaluation (Gardner et al., 2020), our findings suggest that training with counterfactually-augmented data leads to less resilient models.

OPPO稍早确认将于5月27日晚间6点发布Reno 6系列手机，并宣布由艺人周冬雨担任中国地区的品牌代言人。此次将推出标准款Reno 6，以及规格更高的Reno 6 Pro和Reno 6 Pro+。

Venus is often referred to as Earth's sister planet or "Earth's twin" due to its similar density and size in comparison to Earth. Scientists have made attempts to explore Venus using small robots, but these robots only survived for a few hours on its surface. Venus is believed to have been similar to Earth in the past, possibly covered in oceans, green life, and other forms of life before Earth. Scientists are reluctant to physically visit Venus due to the extreme dangers they would encounter. Venus's atmosphere is composed of a thick layer of almost 97% carbon dioxide, with clouds of sulfuric acid, temperatures soaring to at least 800 degrees, and an atmospheric pressure 90 times higher than Earth's.

The author suggests that scientists should overcome the challenges to explore Venus up close to gain valuable insights. Despite the risks, the opportunity to study Venus firsthand could provide unique and valuable information. **Le Contexte de l'Accident**

Mary-Linda Arnoux participait à une activité de rafting offerte par Répit Jeunesse, à Victoriaville, dans le cadre d'un programme d'intervention psychosociale. L'organisme a fait appel à Face aux vents, spécialisé dans la thérapie de plein air et d'aventure. Selon les premières informations de la Sûreté du Québec, elle portait l'équipement approprié et aurait reçu la formation nécessaire. Sa fiche ne faisait pas état de sa peur de l'eau.

**Les Circonstances de l'Accident**

On ne connaît pas les circonstances exactes de l'accident, mais il est rapporté que l'eau affichait quelques degrés jeudi. La jeune femme aurait porté une combinaison isothermique. Une chute involontaire dans l'eau très froide peut causer un choc thermique important, et la panique peut mener à l'hyperventilation. Même avec un gilet de sauvetage, si le visage est contre l'eau, les risques de mort sont élevés.

**Les Inquiétudes de ses Amies**

Des amies de Mary-Linda ont affirmé qu'elle avait peur de l'eau. « Elle ne savait pas nager », confie Josianne Lapointe, une amie du secondaire. Julie Chouinard, une bonne copine des 12 dernières années, y voyait carrément une phobie. Mary-Linda avait mentionné à Pâques son intention de participer à une expédition de rafting, mais sans en parler davantage. Mme Chouinard en veut aux organisateurs d'avoir laissé son amie, en mauvaise forme physique et ne sachant pas nager, participer à l'expédition.

**Les Conséquences et Enquêtes**

L'enquête se poursuit pour déterminer les circonstances de la mort de Mary-Linda Arnoux. Une autopsie sera pratiquée pour connaître les causes exactes de sa mort. Ses amis comptent organiser une marche à sa mémoire à Victoriaville et une autre dans le quartier gai en juin. « C'est très difficile pour nous », témoigne Julie Chouinard.

Facial Action Coding is a system that can detect and analyze facial expressions to identify emotions such as happiness, surprise, anger, disgust, fear, and sadness. While this technology may have potential benefits, its implementation in a classroom setting raises concerns about privacy and distraction for students.

In a classroom environment, where students are already dealing with academic pressures and personal emotions, having Facial Action Coding could lead to unintended consequences. Students may feel uncomfortable knowing that their facial expressions are being monitored, especially if they are trying to hide their emotions, such as a crush or academic struggles, from their peers and teachers.

It is important to consider alternative settings, such as hospitals and nursing homes, where Facial Action Coding could be more beneficial. In healthcare settings, this technology could assist in assessing patients' emotional states and providing appropriate care, especially for individuals who may have difficulty expressing their feelings verbally, such as the elderly or those in pain.

Furthermore, the potential for misinterpretation of data generated by Facial Action Coding in a classroom setting, where students may have varying levels of understanding, could create challenges for teachers in tailoring their instruction to meet students' needs effectively. This could lead to a situation where students who are struggling academically may not receive the necessary support, while those who are already excelling may be overlooked, ultimately impacting the overall learning environment.

In conclusion, while Facial Action Coding may have its merits, its implementation in schools may not be the most suitable choice, given the potential privacy, distraction, and educational implications. It is, therefore, important to carefully consider the appropriate contexts and settings for the use of this technology, ensuring that the well-being and learning experiences of students are prioritized.

In [8], Hamada and Yoshimura defined the middle graph of a graph. The middle graph M(G) of a graph G is the graph obtained by subdividing each edge of G exactly once and joining all these newly introduced vertices of adjacent edges of G. The precise definition of M(G) is as follows. The vertex set V(M(G)) is V(G) ∪ E(G). Two vertices v, w ∈ V(M(G)) are adjacent in M(G) if (i) v, w ∈ E(G) and v, w are adjacent in G or (ii) v ∈ V(G), w ∈ E(G) and v, w are incident in G.

Let G = (V, E) be a connected undirected graph with the vertex set V = V(G) and edge set E = E(G). The order of G is defined as the cardinality of V. The open neighborhood of v ∈ V(G) is the set N(v) = {u ∈ V(G) | uv ∈ E(G)} and the closed neighborhood of v ∈ V(G) is the set N[v] := N(v) ∪ {v}. The degree of v ∈ V(G) is defined as the cardinality of N(v), denoted by degG(v). When no confusion arises, we may delete the subscript G in degG(v). The maximum degree and minimum degree of G are denoted by ∆(G) and δ(G), respectively. We write Pn, Cn and Kn for a path, a cycle, and a complete graph, respectively.

In the graph domination, a set of vertices is selected as guards such that each vertex not selected has a guard as a neighbor. As a generalization of the graph domination, Breśar et al. introduced the concept of rainbow domination in [3]. In the k-rainbow domination, k-different types of guards are required in the neighborhood of a non-selected vertex. Let [k] be the set of positive integers at most k. A function f: V(G) → P([k]) is a k-rainbow dominating function on G if for each vertex v ∈ V(G) for which f(v) = ∅, it holds that u ∈ N(v) f(u) = [k]. The weight of a k-rainbow dominating function is the value v∈V(G) |f(v)|. The k-rainbow domination number γrk(G) is the minimum weight of a k-rainbow dominating function on G. In [4], Chang et al. proved that the k-rainbow domination is NP-complete.

Deep neural networks (NN) have made significant advancements in various tasks such as classification, detection, and segmentation. However, most existing models are computationally extensive and overparameterized, making it challenging to deploy them on real-world devices. To tackle this issue, many efforts have been directed towards compressing heavy models into lighter versions through techniques like knowledge distillation (Hinton et al., 2015b), quantization (Hubara et al., 2018), and pruning (LeCun et al., 1989).

Network pruning, which involves identifying sparse sub-networks (also known as sparse masks) by removing unnecessary connections, has emerged as one of the most effective methods (LeCun et al., 1990; Han et al., 2015a, b; Li et al., 2016; Liu et al., 2019; Frankle & Carbin, 2018). Recently, there has been a significant focus on developing more sophisticated and efficient pruning algorithms to improve the training of sparse subnetworks.

While the common belief emphasizes the importance of high-quality sparse masks for effective training from scratch, this paper explores an alternative approach by enhancing the training protocols for sparse sub-networks. The research demonstrates that customizing the sparse training protocols can lead to significantly better performance using the same sparse mask. This work addresses issues such as poor gradient flow and chaotic optimization trajectories that hinder the optimal convergence of sparse masks.

The paper introduces a toolkit of sparse retraining techniques (ToST) that, when applied to the training of sparse masks identified by existing pruning algorithms, significantly reduce training instability and enhance the performance and generalization of trained sub-networks.

Key contributions of this work include:
- Challenging the conventional belief by advocating for improving training techniques for pruned masks, resulting in enhanced performance of sparse masks identified by various pruning algorithms.
- Providing an easily adaptable training toolkit (ToST) for training ANY sparse mask from scratch, incorporating techniques such as "ghost" skip-connection, "ghost" soft neurons, and modifications to initialization and labels.
- Reporting extensive experiments across different datasets, network architectures, and mask options, showcasing the immediate performance boost achieved by incorporating the proposed techniques in sparse retraining.

**Sixteen Photos That Capture the Adrenaline-Fueled Action of the GTA’s Wild Rodeos**

While rodeos are typically associated with rural parts of Canada, just outside the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), a group of daring riders is eager to test their skills in the arena. Photographer Daniel Neuhaus from Toronto Life spent several weekends capturing the excitement at the Grand Valley and Markham Fair Rodeos. Here, he shares insights into some of his favorite shots.

In rodeo competitions, riders are paired with broncos using a draw from a hat, leaving them in suspense until two hours before the event. Featured in one of Neuhaus' photos is 19-year-old Mason Duijsens, originally from Holland and now residing in Erin, Ontario. The aim is to remain on the horse for eight seconds with one hand while keeping your feet in the stirrups. Afterward, judges score the performance, considering both rider and horse, with the winner receiving prize money and sometimes a belt buckle. "He is a tough horse to ride and improves with each rodeo," Duijsens says of his mount. "He acts up in the chutes and has some smart moves. Unfortunately, I didn’t stay on him for eight seconds that weekend."

Duijsens learned to ride at a local farm. During practice one night, he heard there was a shortage of bronc riders for an upcoming rodeo. "I wanted to impress this girl, so I decided to give it a try," he shares. "I got on my first bronc, and I was hooked. I impressed the girl, but that didn't last much longer."

He finds the mental aspect of competing the most challenging: "When you barely have enough money for entry fees and food, miss your family, and are still in pain from the previous rodeo, it’s tough. You need to stay focused and maintain a positive attitude. Luckily, my rodeo family helps with that."

Twenty-three-year-old Shelby McGowan and her horse, Dee, are barrel racers. In this event, the rider and horse maneuver around three barrels set in a cloverleaf pattern. The fastest time wins, with penalties for hitting barrels. "Keeping your head in the right place, even when things don't go as planned, helps you pick yourself up and try again," McGowan says.

Sixteen-year-old Brad Vanuden from Nestleton, Ontario, rode a bull named Beach Bum. Brad is pictured with the Roughstock Crew after successfully staying on for eight seconds at the Markham Rodeo. "We met at the rodeo. We do everything together, and I couldn't do it without them," he says.

The Brazilian professional rodeo riders are another highlight. "In Brazil, rodeo is one of the most popular sports," says Warlen Velton. "What hockey is to Canadians, rodeo is to us in rural areas. Back home, riders commit to a single rodeo for several days. But here in Ontario, I can ride in four different rodeos in four days."

Nineteen-year-old Andrew Deschamps is a bullfighter aspiring to make rodeo his career. Bullfighters use themselves as bait to distract bulls from fallen riders. "My job is to protect the bull rider at all times, no matter what," he says. "Last year, a cow with one horn came after me. I thought, ‘no problem, it’s just a cow,’ but she threw me in the air and embarrassed me."

Eighteen-year-old Ally Mackey rides her horse, Hannah Brown. "The craziest thing that happened to me during a rodeo was when Riker, one of my horses, reared up before entering the chute. The buttons on my shirt got caught on the saddle horn, and I didn’t realize until I passed the first barrel that my shirt was flapping open."

The flank strap seen on the bull is made from soft cotton, encouraging the bull to buck without causing harm. Rodeo bulls are treated like athletes, receiving high levels of care and attention.

The two cowboys in the background are the "pick-up men." They work in pairs to assist the bronc rider by pulling him onto their horses and removing the flank strap from the bronc, herding it back to the chutes. In the case of a fallen rider, they protect the rider much like bullfighters.

Jess Brock’s horse, Toad, is a 13-year-old half-standardbred, half-quarter horse. "I’ve owned him since he was a year old, and I trained him myself," Brock says. "His personality makes up for his lack of pedigree. He’s taken me to the winner’s circle many times. As much as I love the sport, my horses love it more."

Behind the chutes, emotions run high. Some riders pray and focus, while others hype themselves up by pounding their chests or chanting. Occasionally, nerves get the best of someone.

Bull riding is a dangerous, gritty sport. Many riders wear hockey helmets and Kevlar vests to protect against the bull's horns, though more seasoned riders often wear only a western shirt and cowboy hat. Bulls typically work about 10 minutes a year, in eight-second intervals, maintaining their adrenaline and competitive edge before losing interest.

In the article "The Challenge of Exploring Venus," the author delves into the complexities and potential benefits of studying Venus. Despite the formidable challenges posed by Venus's harsh environment, which includes extreme temperatures, high pressure, and toxic atmospheric conditions, the author argues that the wealth of information and resources that could be gleaned from exploring Venus is substantial.

The author begins by highlighting past failed attempts to study Venus due to its inhospitable conditions. These challenges have led researchers to explore alternative methods for investigating the planet. NASA has proposed a concept where humans could remain above Venus's surface in hot air balloons or utilize rovers equipped with mechanical systems to collect samples and gather data. These approaches offer a way to circumvent direct exposure to Venus's hostile environment while still enabling scientific exploration.

Scientists believe that studying Venus could provide valuable insights into Earth's history and potential future scenarios. There are indications that Venus may have had conditions suitable for life in the distant past, similar geological features as Earth such as oceans, valleys, mountains, and craters. Understanding these similarities between Earth and Venus could offer crucial knowledge for planetary research and enhance our understanding of celestial bodies within our universe.

Ultimately, despite the risks involved in exploring such a challenging environment as Venus, the author contends that the rewards of acquiring new knowledge make it a worthwhile endeavor.

Le gouvernement albertain confirme la fermeture imminente du centre de consommation supervisée au centre Sheldon M. Chumir. Cependant, il assure que des services similaires seront bientôt disponibles via deux autres organismes à Calgary.

Selon Justin Marshall, attaché de presse du sous-ministre des dépendances et de la santé mentale, le centre de consommation supervisée actuel a été très perturbant pour le quartier. Ainsi, il sera remplacé par l'intégration de services de consommation supervisée dans deux organismes partenaires existants, dans des emplacements plus appropriés.

Sans préciser les organismes partenaires ni leurs localisations, Marshall a indiqué que le centre Safeworks, situé au centre Sheldon M. Chumir, est actuellement le seul établissement de consommation supervisée dans la métropole. Les personnes ayant des dépendances y bénéficient d'un environnement propre et sécurisé pour la consommation de drogue, sous la supervision de professionnels formés pour intervenir en cas de surdose.

De octobre à décembre 2020, 508 personnes ont fréquenté le centre au moins une fois, avec 73 cas de surdose nécessitant l'administration de naloxone. Comme tous les centres de consommation supervisée en Alberta, Safeworks a dû appliquer des mesures de distanciation physique et sanitaires en 2020, accueillant moins de clients que l'année précédente.

Avec l'augmentation des décès par surdose en Alberta, passant de 797 en 2019 à 1316 en 2020, et 238 en seulement deux mois de 2021, l'importance des centres de consommation supervisée est soulignée. Malgré les inquiétudes du gouvernement Kenney sur leur impact sur la criminalité et le désordre communautaire, de nombreux experts en santé publique considèrent ces centres comme vitaux pour sauver des vies.

Suite à la fermeture du centre de consommation supervisée de Boyle Street à Edmonton, le gouvernement a promis de redistribuer son financement aux deux autres centres du quartier. Le maire d'Edmonton a critiqué le gouvernement Kenney pour sa gestion de la crise des opioïdes, l'accusant d'aggraver la situation.

Dans un courriel défendant l'action de son gouvernement, Justin Marshall a souligné l'importance de respecter les engagements pris quant à l'expansion des services de consommation supervisée.

芬兰政府无条件为游民提供住房，以提升其生活尊严。（图片来源：施凯文/台湾醒报）分享到 Facebook

芬兰通过无条件为游民提供住所的政策，成功应对了日益增加的游民问题，成为欧洲唯一逆势解决此问题的国家。据报告显示，该政策实施后，芬兰的游民人数已从1.8万人大幅减少至7000人。这一举措不仅改善了游民的居住环境，还节省了社会成本和医疗资源，每位芬兰公民平均每年节省约1.5万欧元。

保障游民的居住权

据《欧洲新闻台》报道，当欧洲各国对游民人数的增长感到束手无策时，芬兰将改善游民的心理健康作为首要任务，成为唯一成功逆转游民问题的国家。如今，漫步在芬兰的街头，已很难见到游民的踪影。

最近，芬兰住宅开发中心的统计数据显示，自1987年以来，芬兰的游民人数已从1.8万降至7000人以下，而且大部分游民现在都有一个“家”。与其他国家要求游民先解决自身健康问题不同，芬兰政府通过“保障居住”政策，无条件为游民提供住房。

Y基金会是与芬兰政府合作解决游民问题的组织，其执行长卡金恩表示：“每个人都需要一个居住的地方，这是基本人权。有了这一基础，我们的专业人员才能帮助他们解决后续的问题。”

改善游民的形象

据《卫报》报道，芬兰政府大幅减少游民收容所的数量，以改善社会对游民的刻板印象。2008年，首都赫尔辛基有558间收容所，如今已减少到52所。欧洲游民工作协会主任史宾纽威表示：“人们普遍将收容所的形象与游民联系在一起，政府将收容所改造成适宜居住的住房有助于改善这一形象。”

This piece presents my opinions on the topic of driverless cars and explains my reasoning behind them. I believe you will find my perspective compelling.

In my view, driverless cars offer significant benefits. Advanced computer systems can detect danger more quickly than the human eye or mind. For instance, if a small animal suddenly darts in front of your car, you might hit it because of your speed and the delayed realization of the animal's presence. In contrast, the quick response of a driverless car could prevent the accident.

Another advantage of driverless cars is the reduced risk of injury. Consider the situation where you're driving after a long, exhausting day. If you fall asleep at the wheel, the car, noticing the absence of your hands on the wheel, would safely come to a stop. This feature significantly enhances the safety of the driver and others on the road.

In conclusion, the reasons I've outlined illustrate the enhanced safety of driverless cars. While I acknowledge the existence of potential dangers, I believe the benefits outweigh the drawbacks. I hope the reader of this piece finds the argument convincing.

أضافت الهيئة، في ردها على التقرير، أنها لاحظت قلة معرفة معدي التقرير في التشريعات الناظمة للعملية الانتخابية، وعدم متابعة كل ما صدر عن الهيئة خلال فترة إدارتها للانتخابات، خلافاً لأبجديات الرقابة على العملية الانتخابية. كما أشارت إلى أن التقرير اعتمد على الحديث الدارج عن الانتخابات، وليس المهني لجهة رقابية، وهذا يتضح من المرفقات وهي في أغلبها من صور تداولتها وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي، بدلاً من إعداد مادة خاصة بالمركز.

وأكد 81% من أفراد العينة أنهم لم يواجهوا أي صعوبات أثناء العمل، بينما قال 19% من مجموع العينة إن معظم الصعوبات التي واجهتهم تلخصت بقضايا إدارية تخص المركز وإدارته للرقابة كالتوزيع الجغرافي للمراقبين لمسافات بعيدة وساعات عمل طويلة.
قالت: لقد خلا التقرير من ذكر الإيجابيات أو التحديات التي عالجتها الهيئة في إدارتها للعملية الانتخابية؛ مما يدلل على عدم الاحترافية في إعداده.
وأفاد 40% من مجموع العينة أنهم تلقوا تدريبا لمرة واحدة عبر تطبيق زوم لمدة أقل من ساعتين، بينما أكد 11% من أفراد العينة انهم لم يتلقوا أي تدريب من قبل المركز لتأهيلهم لمراقبة الانتخابات، وتم الاكتفاء بتسليمهم نماذج لتعبئتها.

De momento se desconoce cuántos funcionarios recibirían la vacuna inicialmente o si se les administraría a Trump o a Pence.

El gobierno de Trump está implementando la campaña de vacunación bajo la continuidad federal de los planes del gobierno, señalaron los funcionarios.

“Funcionarios de alto rango en los tres poderes del gobierno recibirán las vacunas de acuerdo con la continuidad de los planes del gobierno establecidos en la política ejecutiva”, dijo John Ulyot, portavoz del Consejo Nacional de Seguridad. “El pueblo estadounidense debería tener la confianza de que están recibiendo la misma vacuna segura y efectiva que los funcionarios de alto rango del gobierno de Estados Unidos, bajo las recomendaciones de los profesionales de la salud pública y el liderazgo de seguridad nacional”, agregó.
