Un résident de la plus grande "kommunalka" (appartement communautaire) de Saint-Pétersbourg, le 23 octobre 2018 en Russie.

Trente-quatre pièces sont réparties le long d'un immense couloir de près de 100 mètres dans une "kommunalka" en état de délabrement avancé. La vie en appartement communautaire, une survivance de l'époque soviétique, ne fait presque plus partie du quotidien des Russes, à l'exception de ceux de Saint-Pétersbourg.

Cette kommunalka, située dans le centre de l'ancienne capitale impériale russe, non loin du port de commerce, est la plus grande de la ville. Elle occupe pratiquement tout un étage d'un petit immeuble construit en 1958.

De l'extérieur, le bâtiment de quatre étages, initialement destiné à accueillir un foyer pour médecins, semble en bon état. Les étages supérieurs sont occupés par des appartements classiques. Seul le rez-de-chaussée a été transformé dans les années 1980 en appartement communautaire lorsque la polyclinique du quartier a déménagé.

Il y a quelques années, une centaine de personnes y vivaient encore. Dmitri, un chauffeur de 47 ans qui est arrivé dans les années 2000, se souvient des files d'attente fréquentes pour les toilettes et les douches.

CIUDAD DE MÉXICO (apro).- Raúl Padilla, presidente de la Feria Internacional del Libro (FIL) de Guadalajara, informó que la 35 edición terminó con una pérdida de 18 millones de pesos debido a las restricciones de la pandemia por covid-19 y la inasistencia de varias casas editoriales. “Si se comparan las cifras de egreso, 105 frente a 87, este año sí salimos con un déficit de 18 millones”, reconoció, pero dijo que este monto se amortizará en 2022.

Padilla indicó que a esta edición acudieron cerca de 251 mil 900 visitantes con un programa que, por primera vez en su historia, contó con un formato híbrido y dos sedes, “lo que reafirma el agrado con el que los lectores hemos recibido el regreso presencial de la feria. Sí, distantes de los cerca de 850 mil que ya nos estaban visitando en años anteriores a la pandemia, pero una cantidad importante que permitió un extraordinario flujo, manejo y ventas”.

En su informe, Padilla señaló que a pesar de la reducción del aforo respecto al periodo antes de la pandemia y una menor asistencia de editoriales internacionales, la feria cerró una edición híbrida en la que el 70 por ciento de las mil 621 actividades fueron presenciales. Precisó que, de los 251 mil 900 asistentes, 205 mil se congregaron en la Expo Guadalajara, el recinto ferial principal, donde se aplicaron estrictos protocolos sanitarios, se implementaron dos horarios para los visitantes y se ampliaron los pasillos para evitar la conglomeración de personas.

No obstante, la reducción de asistentes es significativa en comparación con las casi 850 mil personas que ingresaban en ediciones anteriores, pero esto permitió “un extraordinario flujo y manejo” de las personas que evitó que en la feria se presentara algún caso de contagio de la covid-19 y, además, favoreció las ventas, subrayó Padilla.

**Lui aussi craint pour son pays, profondément heurté par un énième attentat commis sur le sol français au nom de l’islam.** Comme beaucoup, cet homme attend de ses représentants qu’ils se saisissent du problème. Mais en l’écrivant dans un mail, après la décapitation de Samuel Paty à Conflans-Sainte-Honorine, il s’est attiré des ennuis.

### **Un mail qui déclenche une visite des gendarmes**
Selon le quotidien *Ouest-France*, cet habitant d’une petite commune proche d’Angers a reçu la visite des gendarmes à son domicile le mardi 20 octobre. Dans son message adressé aux députés du Maine-et-Loire, il écrivait : « En tant que citoyen français et père de famille, je vous demande instamment de prendre immédiatement les dispositions d’exception qui permettront de chasser dans les plus brefs délais les islamistes de France ou de les mettre hors d’état de nuire. » Il concluait ce mail par des mots lourds de sous-entendus : « Sans action rapide de votre part, je considère que vous porterez l’entière responsabilité des évènements qui suivront. Bien sincèrement. »

L’échange a suscité une forte réaction de la députée LREM Stella Dupont, qui a jugé nécessaire de signaler ce message à la préfecture. Selon ses propos rapportés par *Ouest-France*, c’est la dernière phrase du courrier, évoquant les « évènements qui suivront », qui a éveillé ses inquiétudes. « J’ai suivi la procédure classique : quand on reçoit un message préoccupant, on le signale. J’ai hésité, car la menace n’était pas manifeste. Et la préfecture a dû juger qu’il y avait matière à vérifier. Finalement, il n’y avait pas d’intention malveillante, et je m’en réjouis. Mais nous devons tous être vigilants », a-t-elle expliqué au journal.

### **« J’ai été vraiment abasourdi »**
Pour le père de famille, cette visite des forces de l’ordre a été une surprise totale. « J’ai été vraiment abasourdi de voir que l’on m’envoyait les gendarmes pour un tel courrier », a-t-il confié à *Ouest-France*.

Driverless Cars: A Cautious Perspective

I am not in favor of driverless cars. Despite Google co-founder Sergey Brin’s confidence in them, I am not ready to entrust my life or my family’s life to these vehicles, even after extensive testing and claims of 100% safety. 

Electronics can fail, and this inherent risk is why I am hesitant to rely on driverless cars. A malfunction could jeopardize my family’s safety. 

The text mentions that "drivers need to stay alert at all times." If the car is supposedly 100% safe, why can’t we relax and converse with our family while on the move?

Additionally, the text raises the issue of accountability in the event of an accident, questioning whether the owner or the manufacturer would be to blame. Why invest in a driverless car if the owner might be held responsible, despite the manufacturer's claims of complete safety?

These points illustrate why I prefer a car I can drive, rather than one that, in my view, is not yet completely safe. 

I pose the question to you: would you prefer to move forward with the rest of the world, potentially putting lives at risk with a driverless car, or would you rather drive a car yourself, helping to ensure the safety of others?

Sometimes, going against the flow might be the best course of action to stay safe.

Policy gradient methods are a popular class of reinforcement learning algorithms designed to handle applications with continuous action spaces, where traditional methods like Q-learning fall short. Notable successes of these methods include robotics, emergent tool usage, and games. However, a common issue with policy gradient methods is their inefficiency in utilizing samples, as they require a substantial amount of on-policy experience after each parameter update. Hence, they are most commonly used in scenarios with access to multiple fast simulators.

To move beyond simulation-based applications and towards real-world implementation, it is crucial to make better use of collected experience. One approach is to enhance sample efficiency by incorporating off-policy samples, which can be obtained from dedicated behavioral policies. Off-policy learning, in general, involves learning under various behavioral policies, often by combining on-and off-policy samples, for instance, through experience replay mechanisms, to prevent discarding valuable experience with policy updates. Off-policy policy gradient (OPPG) methods, in particular, utilize a modified version of the on-policy objective, known as the excursion objective, to estimate returns from off-policy samples, avoiding the high variance associated with traditional importance sampling techniques.

Le candidat à la mairie de Saguenay, Dominic Gagnon, ne sera pas en lice lors des élections du 7 novembre. C'est ce qu'il a annoncé par voie de communiqué en fin de journée lundi. "Je répète sans cesse l’importance pour tout politicien d’être en phase avec la population. Depuis quatre ans, mes actions politiques ont d’ailleurs toujours été en ce sens", a affirmé Dominic Gagnon dans le document transmis aux médias. "Aujourd’hui, force est de constater que malgré tous les efforts consentis, l’électorat se tournera le 7 novembre prochain vers un changement qui sera autre que celui que je propose."

Il s'agissait de la deuxième course à la mairie pour le médecin. En 2017, il avait été défait par Josée Néron alors qu'il défendait les couleurs de l'ancien parti politique du précédent maire Jean Tremblay. En juin 2019, le nom avait été changé pour Alliance Saguenay. Le parti avait finalement été sabordé en novembre 2020. Dominic Gagnon était demeuré très présent sur la scène municipale, participant à de nombreuses reprises aux assemblées du conseil municipal et des conseils d'arrondissement.

Lors de l'élection en 2017, Dominic Gagnon avait récolté seulement 6,15 % des votes, terminant au 4e rang derrière Josée Néron, Jean-Pierre Blackburn et Arthur Gobeil. Il s'était ensuite présenté à l'élection partielle dans le district 1 en décembre 2019. Il avait de nouveau pris le 4e rang sur cinq candidats avec 21,3 % des voix exprimées. Dans les récents sondages réalisés récemment par les firmes Segma et Navigator, il demeurait sous la barre des 10 % dans les intentions de vote.

Après plusieurs mois de campagne, deux messages ressortent clairement des gens que j’ai rencontrés sur le terrain : d’une part, il nous faut un changement d’administration, mais d’autre part, il y a trop de candidats pour y arriver. "Il doit y avoir un candidat qui incarne cette grande déception face à l’actuelle administration, mais force est d’admettre aujourd’hui que je ne serai pas cette personne", a-t-il ajouté sans appuyer aucun autre candidat toujours en lice.

去年，SEGA公布了家用版《新樱大战》（又称樱花大战）的计划。最近，在SEGA Fes正式公布了游戏的新详情。《樱大战V》延续了12年的故事。最特别的是，这次游戏找来了《Bleach死神》的作者久保带人进行人物设定。大家会喜欢这个新设定吗？

《新樱大战》已确定名称并非第六作的延续。SEGA似乎希望将其视为新系列的延续。因此，他们放弃了1至5代中的画师藤岛康介，转而请来了备受欢迎的漫画家《Bleach死神》的久保带人进行人设设计。记者认为男主角的形象确实更加吸引人，但在女主角方面似乎有些欠缺（可能不够萌、不够可爱）。

此外，这一部作品采用了3D效果，并且官方表示将会包含多达40分钟以上的3D故事动画，以满足各位粉丝的需求。

新故事设定于《樱大战V - 再见我所爱的人》之后的12年，在帝都东京。在那场降魔大战中，帝都、巴黎和纽约华击团消失了10年后，世界各地涌现出了新的华击团，并将参与“世界华击团大战”。主角神山诚十郎领导着“新·帝国华击团”，他们不仅要面对降魔带来的威胁，还要应对各国华击团的挑战。

游戏系统将延续前作的“AVG+SLG”模式，但整体内容将会有大幅提升。在AVG部分，采用了3D冒险形式，玩家可以控制男主角在大帝国剧场和银座街头自由探索冒险，并与各女主角互动，提升她们的好感度。好感度越高，对战斗就越有帮助（可能会提升战力或合作技能等）。当然，每位女主角都有各自专属的结局（类似恋爱游戏）。

The natural connections between approximation theory and optimization, both aiming at finding the "best" solution, were first established in the '50s, '60s, and '70s as interest grew in the application of convex analysis within Functional Analysis [16, 24, 39, 40]. Laurent's book in 1972 demonstrated interconnections between approximation and optimization, showing that challenging approximation problems could be tackled using optimization techniques, such as approximating nonsmooth functions with splines. Rational approximations can be a good compromise between accuracy and computational efficiency when dealing with complex optimization problems, especially when spline knot locations are unknown.

It has been long known that optimization problems arising in rational and generalized rational approximation are quasiconvex, with one of the simplest methods for minimizing such functions being the bisection method [12]. Feasibility problems in rational approximation can be efficiently reduced to solving large-scaled linear programming problems, making the optimization approach tractable and practical. The optimization approach for min-max approximation is explored in this paper, showing that it can be more manageable than least squares. An enhanced algorithm is proposed, incorporating constraints like bounds on the denominator, improving applicability for diverse problems, including evaluating matrix functions.

Matrix functions, which involve lifting scalar functions to a matrix domain, have become increasingly important in various applications like reduced order models, ODE solving, image denoising, and graph neural networks. Rational approximation for matrix functions has emerged as a valuable alternative due to its superior approximation capabilities, although challenges remain in its application. The paper delves into the use of rational approximation for normal matrices, introducing a parameter that balances uniform approximation and matrix conditioning, providing theoretical guarantees, numerical demonstrations, and showcasing an algorithm application for matrix filtering.

In summary, the paper presents an optimization approach for min-max approximation, highlighting the tractability of the min-max problem compared to least squares. It discusses the advantages of rational approximation for evaluating matrix functions, particularly in the case of normal matrices. The proposed algorithm addresses the tradeoff between uniform approximation and matrix conditioning, offering theoretical guarantees and practical insights through numerical demonstrations and application examples.

Denmark has decided not to include Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine in its immunization program after health authorities deemed the risk of blood clots unacceptable, as reported by local media, including broadcaster TV2. This decision follows Denmark's earlier move to become the first European Union member to stop using AstraZeneca Plc's vaccine for similar reasons. There was a flash of blinding white light. There was no noise, but my ears were ringing. As the light died down, I saw it: an anomaly with the fourth dimension, a tear in time itself. Within it, a set of eyes stared back at mine, familiar yet so vibrant and lively. My young face, perhaps thirty years younger, appeared in the frame, wondrous and confused. Memories began to race through my mind, memories of a time that seemed so far gone, yet imbued with a spirit that was meant to fuel my entire life. I wondered if I looked disappointing to him, my younger self, but I hoped my words might forge a better life in another world, a life that I, too, might appreciate. I smiled. 

"Hey," I said, my voice seeming vague and distant. 

"Hi," he replied, in that small, familiar voice, retaining the same face I knew so well. 

"I'm not sure how long we have to talk, but there's definitely something I should tell you," I said, leaning closer, trying to convey the urgency of the moment. "Things don't turn out so bad when you get older, but I want you to be you, and, especially, not like me."

AMC娱乐（AMC Entertainment）和电玩游戏零售商GameStop的股价在周四大幅下挫，距离最近的高点已经腰斩，考验着散户股东的耐心。这两家公司一直是「史诗级疯涨」的迷因股，吸引了不少投资者的关注。

AMC股价已连跌4天，周三收盘重挫15%，报33.43美元，比6月初的历史高点（约72.62美元）下跌了近54%。而GameStop周三下跌6.9%，收于167.62美元，股价已与6月8日的高点（344.66美元）相比下跌一半。

尽管股价大幅下挫，但AMC和GameStop仍保持着今年初以来的巨大涨幅。今年以来，AMC股价上涨了1,476%，而GameStop上涨了789%。

这两支股票最近的低迷走势可能给最近才入市的散户投资者带来煎熬。散户们常在Reddit等论坛自吹自擂，但现在市场的兴趣减弱可能导致股价继续下跌。

Retired Lt. Col. Herbert Carter, who flew 77 missions in Europe during World War II with the famed Tuskegee Airmen, died at the age of 95 on Thursday at the East Alabama Medical Center in Opelika, as reported by Stan Ingold of Alabama Public Radio. His passing was confirmed by a family friend and Tuskegee University, where he earned degrees, taught, and later held the position of assistant dean for student services.

In January, Carter spoke to the Montgomery Advertiser and mentioned that only four of the original 33 airmen were still alive. The Tuskegee Airmen were the first black fighter pilots in U.S. history, marking a significant milestone. Carter expressed his hope that his love for flying would be carried on by future generations in his legacy.

After the war, Carter continued his service in the Air Force for 25 years. In a 2008 interview with The Associated Press, Carter reflected on the challenges faced by black soldiers who were respected on base but faced discrimination off-base. The University of Alabama News shared a video in March featuring Carter discussing his wartime experiences.

It is worth noting that conflicting reports about Carter's age have emerged, with some sources stating he was 93 or 94, while two independent sources confirmed he was 95. Wikipédia a donc vingt ans. Mais s’il est un point sur lequel l’encyclopédie peut sembler être restée dans les années 2000, c’est sur le design. D’accord, la critique est rude, et sans doute excessive. Il serait d’ailleurs faux de dire que l’apparence du site n’a jamais bougé ces deux dernières décennies. En outre, plusieurs habillages (Vector, Moderne, MinervaNeue, Monobook, Timeless) sont proposés à l’internaute.

Ces différents styles sont accessibles pour qui dispose d’un compte sur Wikipédia. Il faut se rendre dans le menu des préférences, en haut à droite de l’interface, puis dans l’onglet « Apparence », de choisir l’habillage et de valider. Des options avancées sont aussi fournies, si vous savez ce que vous faites. Les simples lecteurs ne sont pas délaissés : ils profitent du look par défaut du site, qui a été rafraichi au fil des ans.

Il existe néanmoins une solution que tout le monde ne connaît pas, alors qu’elle permet de transformer le design de Wikipédia, sans même avoir besoin d’un compte. L’astuce n’est certes pas récente — elle est évoquée sur le net depuis plusieurs années –, mais mérite un coup de projecteur à l’occasion de son vingtième anniversaire. Son nom ? Wikiwand. Il s’agit d’une surcouche graphique.

Le service peut tout à la fois être utilisé comme un site web (il y a un champ de recherche pour trouver une page Wikipédia, sur la version anglophone de l’encyclopédie) ou bien sous la forme d’une extension pour navigateur (Google Chrome et Mozilla Firefox), à installer pour que le style s’impose automatiquement dès que vous vous trouvez sur une entrée de l’encyclopédie.

Vous voulez voir ce que ça donne avant d’installer quoi que ce soit ? Voyez donc la page classique de Numerama sur Wikipédia et sa déclinaison visuelle une fois passée à la moulinette de Wikiwand. C’est le jour et la nuit : le panneau latéral est redessiné et colorisé, la partie centrale est remaniée, le sommaire est repositionné à gauche — idem pour les photos, quand il y en a.

Wikiwand est un projet distinct de la fondation Wikimédia. De fait, le service redirige sur son site les pages Wikipédia que vous voulez voir sur l’encyclopédie, afin d’y appliquer son interface graphique en question.

Night after night, we'd have dinner together, and she would tell me about her day. Then, we'd settle into bed and drift off to sleep. I loved laying in bed at night, feeling the gentle rise and fall of her chest, and seeing the quirky way she smiled as she dreamed. It was comforting to know she loved me, and she always made me feel loved. Sometimes, she would fidget and wake me up, but I didn't mind. ¿Brotes verdes?: ¿Cuánto subió la inversión en noviembre?

De cara a diciembre, Ferreres proyectó que "en vista de la coyuntura cambiaria, es probable que veamos una nueva expansión de los niveles de inversión".

La inversión, medida en términos de volúmenes físicos, creció un 8,5% en noviembre en comparación con el mismo mes de 2019, según el índice de la consultora Orlando Ferreres. Este fue el primer aumento interanual desde abril de 2018, antes del estallido de la crisis cambiaria que sumió al país en una recesión, agravada por la pandemia del coronavirus.

La mejora fue impulsada por la inversión en maquinaria y equipos, que aumentó un 17,5% interanual. Dentro de este segmento, se destacó el rendimiento de los bienes de capital importados, que mostraron un aumento del 27,1%, mientras que la maquinaria nacional tuvo un avance del 9,2%.

Además, la compra de materiales para la construcción tuvo un crecimiento del 0,9% en comparación con noviembre de 2019, rompiendo una racha de 15 meses con variaciones anuales negativas.

"El fuerte aumento de la brecha cambiaria durante octubre ciertamente tuvo un impacto en las decisiones de compra de los agentes, lo cual se reflejó en noviembre. También es importante destacar que la cifra de noviembre se compara con el peor nivel de inversión visto en 2019", explicaron desde Ferreres.

La consultora destacó los datos de noviembre como una "buena noticia", pero advirtió que "un aumento de la inversión debido a la perspectiva de una futura depreciación de la moneda no puede ser una estrategia efectiva para impulsar la actividad económica a largo plazo".

Según los datos del informe, la inversión en el mes de noviembre alcanzó los u$s5.192 millones, acumulando en el año unos u$s45.232 millones, lo que representa una contracción del 18,6% en comparación con los primeros once meses del año pasado.

Esta variable, al igual que la mayoría de las variables macroeconómicas, se vio afectada por la llegada de la pandemia. La inversión en maquinaria y equipo ha caído un 9,6% en 2020, mientras que la inversión destinada a la construcción ha sufrido una reducción del 26%.

En términos mensuales, la inversión aumentó un 8,6% en comparación con octubre, lo que representa el sexto dato positivo desde mayo. De cara a diciembre, Ferreres proyectó que "en vista de la coyuntura cambiaria, es probable que veamos una nueva expansión de los niveles de inversión".

"Why on earth isn't it already on my desk?! I specifically instructed you to have it ready for my review first thing this morning! If you are causing me to lose valuable time, perhaps you lack the necessary motivation for this job!" Lucy's tone was harsh.

As my fingers hovered over the reply button on the speakerphone, tempted to tell him to "Go to Hell!" and to remind him how he had assigned me the task of preparing the brief for the crucial patent hearing later in the week as he was leaving the day before, forcing me to stay an additional four hours past regular business hours to complete it. The hearing was still four days away, and it involved minor technicalities. His demeanor was completely unwarranted. If I didn't know any better, I would think Mr. Abaddon was the devil incarnate. His behavior was wicked. Nothing seemed good enough or fast enough for him. No bonus pay for successful settlements on behalf of the tech company. No overtime compensation. I had to constantly remind myself of the importance of my role. But if he questioned my motivation once more, the true Patric would emerge from the shadows!

"PATRIC! Why did you change the font size?!" Lucy's voice pierced through the speaker, irritating me.

That's it, I thought to myself, feeling my patience slip away. I stood up to my full height, shedding the facade of a regular mortal.

Le festival Les Égaluantes, le premier du genre lié à la Normandie, se tiendra du vendredi 9 au dimanche 11 décembre 2016 à Carentan-les-Marais (Manche), offrant trois jours dédiés au cinéma. En marge de cet événement, nous avons eu le plaisir de rencontrer Lucien Jean-Baptiste, comédien et réalisateur, qui présentera son nouveau film.

Votre participation à ce festival sera l'occasion de dévoiler en avant-première normande votre dernier film "Il a déjà tes yeux" (sortie nationale le 18 janvier 2017). Qu'est-ce qui vous pousse à venir ici ? "Tout simplement parce que Maxime Delauney, le directeur du festival, est également le producteur de mon film. Cela s'est donc fait naturellement. Je suis en tournée à travers les cinémas de France pour présenter mon film. Après Avignon le matin et Carentan le samedi soir, je traverserai la France pour rejoindre Maxime le dimanche!"

Quels sont vos projets pour ce week-end à Carentan ? "Je présenterai mon film samedi soir à 21 heures, suivi d'un échange avec le public et Maxime. Pour le reste, je m'en remets à l'imprévu. Comme pour tout festival de cinéma, je présume que nous regarderons des films, prendrons quelques verres et rencontrerons des personnes!"

Ce nouveau festival revendique clairement une identité locale. Comment le percevez-vous ? "Je trouve cela formidable! J'apprécie ces festivals à dimension humaine, différents de Cannes, même si ce dernier a sa propre aura, offrant de réelles opportunités d'échanges avec le public, où la culture va à la rencontre des gens. J'ai participé à Berlin, Cannes et Venise, mais ce sont plus des marchés que des festivals à proprement parler. Là-bas, l'accent est davantage mis sur les affaires que sur le cinéma."

"Il a déjà tes yeux" est votre quatrième film en tant que réalisateur. Comment a-t-il été accueilli jusqu'à présent ? "Les retours ont été plutôt positifs. Le film a remporté deux prix du public, à Namur et Malaga. Les spectateurs affirment qu'il apporte une bouffée d'air frais dans le contexte actuel, où certaines forces alimentent la division. J'ai souhaité réaliser un film positif, rassembleur, abordant sereinement les problématiques qui nous concernent tous."

La question de la différence est récurrente dans vos travaux. Est-ce un choix délibéré ? "Effectivement, la différence est une thématique récurrente dans mon œuvre. À travers la comédie, qui touche un large public, je veux montrer que la différence ne doit pas engendrer l'inégalité. Une blonde peut être professeur de mathématiques, une personne en surpoids peut être hôtesse de l'air... Tout est possible, pourvu que l'on s'en donne les moyens."

DeAundric Jaquay Dorsey因强迫16岁少女卖淫，被判处40年有期徒刑。然而，由于法官一再降低保释金，他在庭审第一天后交保获释，随后消失无踪。休斯顿警方发布协寻通知，并向提供线索者最高奖励5000美元。

嫌犯原定受审三天，但他在第一天开庭后就不见踪影。原因是法官Desean Jones两次降低他的保释金，从最初的5万美元减至2.5万美元，然后又降到1.5万美元，嫌犯因此凑到钱交保出监。

哈里斯县检察长Kim Ogg等检警高层在14日联名呼吁民众提供线索，以便将Dorsey绳之以法。Ogg强调，没有人比随时寻找漏洞的罪犯更危险。检方努力寻求受害少女的协助才将他送上法庭，但他却以低保释金获得了逃脱机会。

法庭纪录显示，检方原本主张因嫌犯在密歇根州有前科，具有逃脱风险，且一旦获释会对哈里斯的未成年少女构成严重威胁，因此不应给予保释机会。然而，法官最终仍然批准保释，并一再降低保释金额。

在14日接受ABC采访时，法官Desean Jones坚持，他无法理解为何嫌犯要弃保潜逃。他表示，交保后仍然按时到庭的情况是有前例的，而像这样弃保潜逃的案例他还未曾遇到。

香港明星谭咏麟攻蛋一事，起因于他在台北小巨蛋举办的「银河岁月40载世界巡回演唱会」中演唱了一首《心手相连》，而该歌曲涉嫌未经授权公开演出，遭到共同作词人的控告。控告对象包括谭咏麟本人以及主办单位宽鱼国际和负责人邱汉中，指控他们违反了著作权法。经过台北地检署的调查后，认定谭等人并无主观上的故意侵犯他人权利，因此决定不对三人提起诉讼。

谭咏麟被尊称为「校长」，他在上世纪七十年代早期与钟镇涛一同在温拿乐队担任主唱。去年，他在台北小巨蛋举办了「银河岁月40载世界巡回演唱会台北站」，打破了最高龄华人歌手攻蛋纪录，并邀请了香港艺人曾志伟、郑伊健、陈小春、钱嘉乐、谢天华等以及台湾歌手A-Lin作为嘉宾。

事后，作词人陈建名指出，《心手相连》一曲当年是由他与陈美威、巫玉花、张琼子等多人共同创作，作为其中一位创作者，他并没有授权这次公开演出。

检察官调查后没有传唤当天演唱的谭咏麟，而是针对主办演唱会内容的宽鱼国际公司展开调查。

عقدت اللجنة المركزية لحركة فتح اجتماعاً مساء اليوم الاثنين، برئاسة الرئيس محمود عباس في مقر الرئاسة بمدينة رام الله. في بداية الاجتماع، قرأ الرئيس عباس وأعضاء اللجنة المركزية الفاتحة على روح الشهيد القائد الوطني الكبير محمود الخالدي، وفقاً للوكالة الفلسطينية الرسمية.

بحث الاجتماع آخر المستجدات المتعلقة بالقضية الفلسطينية. واطلع أعضاء اللجنة المركزية على الاتصالات التي تجريها القيادة مع الأطراف الدولية، خاصة اللجنة الرباعية الدولية، لضمان إطلاق عملية سياسية مبنية على قرارات الشرعية الدولية ومبادرة السلام العربية، بهدف إقامة دولة فلسطينية مستقلة عاصمتها القدس الشرقية على حدود العام 1967. كما جدد الرئيس عباس التأكيد على أهمية الإسراع في عقد مؤتمر دولي للسلام بمشاركة الأطراف الدولية ذات العلاقة تحت مظلة الأمم المتحدة كحل للأزمة السياسية الحالية.

فيما يخص الانتخابات، أكد الرئيس على الالتزام بإجراء الانتخابات وفق المواعيد المعلنة في المراسيم الرئاسية. وأشار إلى أنها ستشمل كافة الأراضي الفلسطينية، بما فيها القدس الشرقية، في جميع مراحلها من ترشح ودعاية وانتخاب. وقال: "نجري اتصالات مكثفة مع العديد من الدول، وتحديداً الأمم المتحدة، والولايات المتحدة الأمريكية، والاتحاد الأوروبي، للضغط على الحكومة الإسرائيلية لاحترام الاتفاقيات الموقعة بيننا بشأن العملية الانتخابية، وخصوصاً فيما يتعلق بمشاركة القدس الشرقية". وأوضح أنه لم يرد أي رد من الجانب الإسرائيلي حتى الآن.

ناقشت اللجنة المركزية عدداً من الملفات الحيوية، ومنها:

### ملف الانتخابات:
أكدت اللجنة ضرورة الضغط الدولي، بما في ذلك من الأمم المتحدة والاتحاد الأوروبي وروسيا والصين، على الحكومة الإسرائيلية للالتزام بتعهداتها الموقعة مع منظمة التحرير الفلسطينية بشأن إجراء الانتخابات في الأراضي الفلسطينية كافة، بما فيها القدس الشرقية المحتلة. وشددت اللجنة على أن الشعب الفلسطيني لن يقبل بأي شكل من الأشكال بوجود فيتو احتلالي على العملية الانتخابية، مؤكدة أن القدس وأهلها خط أحمر لا يمكن المساس به. وانتقدت اللجنة قيام قوات الاحتلال بمنع فعاليات المرشحين والاعتداء عليهم، مؤكدة أن هذه المحاولات لن تثني عزيمة الشعب الفلسطيني وقيادته.

### الممارسات الإسرائيلية:
أدانت اللجنة التصعيد الإسرائيلي ضد الشعب الفلسطيني، والذي يشمل بناء المستوطنات وسرقة الأراضي والهدم والمصادرة والاعتقالات اليومية، والاعتداءات على المقدسات الإسلامية والمسيحية. وذكرت اللجنة أن هذه الممارسات تخالف القوانين الدولية وقرارات الشرعية الدولية، بما فيها قرار مجلس الأمن 2334.

### الملف السياسي:
رحبت اللجنة بقرار الإدارة الأمريكية استئناف المساعدات للشعب الفلسطيني، وخاصة دعم وكالة "الأونروا".

Victor, ce candidat de Koh-Lanta qui semble ne pas savoir ni compter ni tirer des leçons de ses erreurs, est parti avec un collier d'immunité qu'il a préféré ne pas utiliser, alors que l'équipe des Jaunes le détestait. Mais en partant, il a transmis son collier à Béatrice, la cheffe d'équipe. Il ambitionnait de marquer l'histoire de La guerre des chefs. Il va surtout rentrer chez lui. Grâce à un coup de poker, Victor espérait devenir le premier candidat de Koh-Lanta à ne pas sortir son collier - étant clairement rejeté par son équipe - et à ne pas être éliminé. Un pari fou qu'il a perdu bêtement, naïvement et logiquement ce vendredi 5 avril. Tout a commencé par une détermination inébranlable : deux jours avant le conseil, donc avant l'épreuve d'immunité, Victor montrait sa farouche volonté de rester dans cette aventure dont les Rouges l'avaient déjà évincé. "Je ne vais pas refaire la même erreur deux fois", clamait-il. Résultat : le revenant, frais comme un gardon, a passé des heures à parcourir les bosses et les fossés de son île, jusqu'à mettre la main sur le collier d'immunité en tendant son bâton. "Ce n'est plus seulement le phénix qui renaît de ses cendres, c'est..." C'est toujours plus. C'est Victor, tout simplement.

Ivre de bonheur, Victor allait même jusqu'à s'inquiéter de ce que faisait sa chère et tendre en son absence : "Dès que j'aurai fini l'aventure, j'appelle ma copine, car trop de chance, tue la chance...". Que Victor se rassure : sa série de malchance n'aura pas duré. De retour au camp, au lieu de garder secrète sa trouvaille, il l'a partagée avec son équipe, tentant des négociations : "Si vous ne votez pas pour moi, je donnerai mon collier à Béatrice, blablabla." Les Jaunes n'ont pas apprécié, et au conseil, ils étaient quatre à voter contre lui. Trois autres candidats ont voté contre Nicolas. Le Belge montrait en effet des signes de faiblesse liés à son fils, Mathis. Plongé dans une eau cristalline à 28°C, le jeune papa exprimait sa tristesse d'être loin de son "énergie vitale", son fils.

La stratégie de Victor tombe à l'eau. D'un autre côté, Sophie pleurait également face caméra, sa fille lui manquant énormément. Ces deux-là en sont venus à discuter de fourches, racines grasses et pointes sèches, la pertinence de ce débat capillaire sur Koh-Lanta étant questionnée. Les autres membres de l'équipe ont perçu un sentiment de déprime. "Nicolas mine le moral de tout le monde." Tellement que des doutes ont germé dans l'esprit audacieux de Victor, qui a pensé qu'il pourrait tenter le coup : se passer de son collier en faisant croire qu'il le jouerait, afin que tous les votes se reportent sur Nicolas. Malheureusement, pour une fois de plus, mauvais calcul : quatre votes contre trois, adieu.

Dans Koh-Lanta ce soir, il y avait aussi :
- Des réunions en maillot de bain dans une eau à 30 degrés, qui est tenté ?
- Des cheveux sales. Très sales. Ceux d'Angélique et de Sophie commencent à ressembler à de la paille.
- "Ce qui m'impressionne, c'est sa générosité, on n'a pas du tout le même caractère, elle et moi." L'égoïsme assumé, par Victor.
- Du slam : "Être sincère, sur des paroles en l'air." (On n'a pas dit que c'était du bon slam).
- L'astuce du jour : si vous en avez assez de vous lever la nuit pour remettre une bûche dans votre cheminée, mettez directement un arbre.
- Des phrases fortes : "Tous les efforts, c'est fatigant."
- Un Nicolas un peu trop affamé : "Il me dit : 'Angélique, quand je te vois, je vois une pizza'. Du coup, ça me fait flipper."
- Des bonnes idées : quand tu pars en randonnée et que tu as oublié ton chapeau (mais pas ton slip).

Ranking data frequently emerges in business contexts such as recommender systems (Karatzoglou et al., 2013; Oliveira et al., 2020) and search engines (Dwork et al., 2001; Liu et al., 2007). Typically, these rankings are gathered to discern users' preferences, facilitating more tailored recommendations in the future. A prime example is a recommender system, which suggests new items to users by utilizing historical data on user behavior. However, such rankings are often sensitive, exposing individuals’ purchasing or political preferences (Yang et al., 2019; Lee, 2015). Therefore, it is crucial to develop an effective mechanism to protect the privacy of ranking data before sharing it with external parties.

To ensure data privacy, differential privacy (DP; Dwork 2006) is commonly adopted as a standard metric. Differential privacy formalizes privacy guarantees using mathematical language without making data assumptions. It has advantageous properties such as immunity to post-processing and privacy composition for sanitized data outputs from privacy-preserving mechanisms. Generally, differential privacy is categorized into two main types: central differential privacy (CDP; Dwork et al., 2006) and local differential privacy (LDP; Wang et al., 2017). LDP involves perturbing data on the users' side, submitting privatized data to servers, whereas CDP relies on a trusted data collector to protect all data. LDP has gained popularity in privacy protection and is now used in real-world applications like the Google Chrome browser (Erlingsson et al., 2014) and macOS (Tang et al., 2017).

Various research efforts have been directed toward developing effective mechanisms to protect ranking data under differential privacy, as well as establishing theoretical results regarding statistical inference from privatized ranking data. Depending on the use of either LDP or CDP, the privacy protection of ranking data can be divided into two main models. In the central DP model, a trusted curator collects non-private rankings from all users and conducts differentially private statistical inference (Hay et al., 2011), though this approach suffers from a loose privacy bound and complex downstream privacy-utility analyses. In contrast, the proposed \(\varepsilon\)-ranking DP employs a single privacy parameter to gauge privacy protection for rankings, avoiding reliance on the composition theorem (Kairouz et al., 2015) and eliminating inaccurate computation of the privacy budget. Under the developed \(\varepsilon\)-ranking DP, we can analyze how privacy guarantees for each ranking affect the performance of downstream inference tasks based on privacy-preserving rankings.

For instance, the \(\varepsilon\)-ranking DP allows for personalized privacy preferences in tasks that require personalized ranking, enabling users to control their privacy settings. Additionally, traditional data perturbation methods like Laplace noise addition do not align well with the ordinal nature of ranks, leading to a suboptimal privacy-utility tradeoff for downstream tasks. We conducted extensive experiments to validate our theoretical results and demonstrate the effectiveness of the synthetic ranking algorithm. This algorithm produces privacy-preserving rankings with greater utility for downstream personalized learning tasks, achieving a better privacy-utility tradeoff.

The contributions of this paper are summarized as follows. First, we develop a synthetic ranking algorithm based on the multistage ranking algorithm (Fligner and Verducci, 1988; Critchlow et al., 1991) to generate privacy-preserving rankings.

Autonomous vehicle navigation is composed of four basic functions: localisation, perception, planning, and control. Despite some research focusing only on one function of autonomous vehicle navigation, end-to-end systems that combine all functions produce more generalised models that can handle more edge cases and unusual scenarios. Several approaches have been proposed to achieve vehicle autonomy for small passenger vehicles. Traditional rule-based methods suffer from accuracy and applicability to real-life scenarios due to their hand-crafted nature. Imitation Learning (IL) and Reinforcement Learning (RL) have also been explored as learning-based approaches. Given accurate training data, IL approaches have shown to achieve suitable performance. On the other hand, RL algorithms are capable of surpassing such performance, converging towards an optimal policy. Online RL algorithms can learn from continually simulated data where different scenarios can be created, producing a more generic model.

Despite significant research in this field, there is limited work publicly available that focuses on heavy goods vehicles. Apart from the aforementioned advantages, the application of autonomous navigation to heavy goods vehicles, specifically tractor-trailer vehicles, can lead to substantial economic growth by increasing the efficiency of the logistics sector, where human drivers are restricted by driving duration constraints and sleeping schedules. Every year, approximately 1.3 million people die due to road traffic accidents with an additional 20 to 50 million people suffering non-fatal injuries. With human error being the leading cause of road accidents, fully autonomous vehicles can help to reduce such fatalities significantly by taking the human driver out of the equation. Furthermore, such vehicles can help with lowering emissions, increasing mobility, and reducing congestion.

What do you do when you're 23 and jobless? You eat pizza, smoke pot, and watch TV. At least, that's what I've been doing for the past six months. 

If you don't believe me, just look at this stack of menus. The pizza place sends a new menu leaflet every time I order (such a waste of paper, I know), and I order at least twice a day—breakfast and dinner. How thick do you think that stack has gotten? 

I'll tell you—THIS thick. 

The truth is, I don't really need a job. My family sends me a nice chunk of change every week. So much so, I even have a tab with my dealer. Every month, he and I settle it over a drink and some—yep, you guessed it—pizza. Those munchies are killer!

This latest batch of nugs he sent over is something different. I feel like trying something different. 

Don't get me wrong, I still want pizza.

**Driverless Cars and Their Risks**

The concept of driverless cars does not appeal to me whatsoever. Trusting technology with something as important as driving is nothing short of dangerous. Think of it this way: do you know that feeling when your computer freezes or when your television goes out? TVs and computers are some of the basic essentials of technology. They have their bugs and do not run flawlessly 24/7. Driverless cars can be the same way. They can freeze and have their bugs. Are you willing to risk the lives of you and your loved ones with a driverless car? I certainly wouldn't, and by the end of this essay, I hope you won't risk it either. 

Driverless cars have been fantasized about for many years. Google employees, such as Sergey Brin and Sebastian Thrun, claim that this fantasy is close to becoming a reality. I, for one, haven't really heard any concrete news on the matter. Sure, the rumors were there, but I honestly haven't seen any of these breakthroughs. I, and many other people, want to see true facts and real results. The fantasy of driverless cars clouds people's judgment, and with such little public attention and news coverage, I can see why I and so many others are skeptical of this idea. 

Technology, as we know, is nothing short of unpredictable. A phone can shut down, a computer can catch a virus, and a TV can blow out. Who knows what a driverless car can do? At least, if a car breaks down, the human driver has some degree of control over the matter. To have that control taken away and replaced by a computer program is, frankly, frightening. A car can be dangerous if in the wrong hands. I don't believe the hands of a lifeless computer program are a good substitute for a human driver.

Conditional data generation is a challenging problem, especially with high-dimensional data. When the partitioning of conditioned data and conditioning can be predetermined, various inference tools like Bayesian inference, variational inference, Gaussian Processes, and Neural Processes can be employed. However, the task becomes more complex when the partitioning cannot be anticipated, which is common in applications such as few-shot learning, image generation, Bayesian optimization, learning with incomplete datasets, and image inpainting.

Assuming data is normally distributed allows for closed-form computation of the conditional distribution using techniques like Gaussian elimination and the Schur complement, leading to solutions like Gaussian Processes. While Gaussian Processes are a valuable tool in machine learning, their restrictive nature requires alternatives for dealing with moderately dimensional data or missing input data.

Normalizing flows offer a way to model complex joint distributions, making them appealing for conditional sampling. However, few solutions exist, such as Projected Latent Monte Carlo Markov Chains (PL-MCMC) and MCFlow, each with limitations in terms of convergence, data imputation, and computational efficiency. ACFlow also presents challenges due to its computational expense.

Various conditioning techniques have been applied with normalizing flows to address conditional data generation without interest in the joint probability distribution. These techniques range from extending amortisation methods to conditional likelihood estimation, using Bayesian Neural Networks for feature embedding, to heuristic posterior conditioning.

The proposed approach, VISCOS Flows, aims to perform conditional sampling in scenarios where data generation is post-training, training data may be incomplete, and the subset of missing data is unknown. Leveraging Schur complement properties and variational posterior, VISCOS Flows focus on deriving a method that reflects the Bayesian perspective accurately, enabling quick recovery of multiple samples and cost-efficient inference across partially observed items.

In conclusion, addressing the challenges of conditional data generation requires innovative approaches like VISCOS Flows, which offer a promising solution for faithfully reflecting the Bayesian perspective in generating conditional data. By leveraging variational posterior and Schur complement properties, VISCOS Flows aim to provide an efficient and effective method for conditional sampling in complex data scenarios.

As I walked towards the heart of the city, I heard a rhythm of bricks and tools as a background to my own footsteps. The polished cobblestone glowed under the straw I used to paint, reflecting the gleam of the stone underneath. Approaching the center, I noticed teams clearing the main street of buildings that encroached upon it. As I strolled through, I met their longing and desperate gazes, grateful for the rubble I obscured. Moving closer to the square, a sense of anticipation grew as the surroundings revealed themselves. Light pierced through the sky, casting shimmering reflections on the windows, only to fall silent.

The paved ground, strewn with mounds of clothed flesh, gave way to ornate steps leading to a great block of marble, upon which three simple wooden crosses stood. Here, the men and women who had cared deeply for us were bound, their struggles long ceased.

There were two types of logic when it came to birthdays. A: Death was coming whether you took precautions or not. For example, death might've planned for you to perish in a horrendous car accident, smashed into jelly. If you didn't drive that day, then it would set you up to spontaneously combust instead. It didn't much care about the means so much as the end. B: As long as you canceled out the specific method that death planned for you, you could extend your life indefinitely by taking extreme precautions and using common sense.

My logic went like this. It was impossible to tell how exactly death went about its business, but one might as well assume option B was the case. If option A was reality, then it wouldn't matter. Many people carried on with their usual routine on their birthday, as calm as Buddhist monks. I considered these people fools. If one subscribed to option B, then at least there was a faint hope of escaping the enveloping blackness known as death. Why not try to avoid one's own end if there was even a small chance that death was easily duped?

The new technology known as the Facial Action Coding System is being used to identify human emotions. While this might seem beneficial in some contexts, I believe it should not be used in classrooms, and here’s why.

First, it's important to consider the privacy and autonomy of students. Many children may not want their emotions to be scanned and exposed. Emotions are personal, and students should have the right to keep them private if they choose. Dr. Huang mentions, "A classroom computer could recognize when a student is becoming confused or bored." While it's true that some students might benefit from additional help, the decision to have their emotions monitored should be theirs.

Teachers have a critical role in the classroom, not only to teach but to care for their students. It’s their responsibility to notice if a student is struggling, without relying on technology to inform them. While some students might hide their emotions, and the Facial Action Coding System could, in theory, help, it should only be used with the students' consent. As Dr. Huang points out, "The facial expressions for each emotion are universal, even though individuals often show varying degrees of expression." This highlights the importance of human interaction, as a computer can never fully replace the nuanced understanding a teacher can provide.

The use of this technology, if directed, should be limited to certain situations, such as in high schools, where students, especially, are under significant stress, such as during finals.

These perturbed images are known as Adversarial Examples. As these attacks grow more sophisticated [30], there is a pressing need for more robust models and improved defense mechanisms [10].

There are three primary benchmark datasets currently used to evaluate the performance of adversarial attacks and defenses on images: MNIST [21], CIFAR10 [19], and ImageNet [20]. ImageNet, in particular, is the most complex, given its 1,000 classes and the size of input images, which are often resized to 224×224 pixels, and sometimes to 300×300. MNIST and CIFAR10 are typically used to demonstrate multiple attacks and defense techniques, but the effectiveness of these attacks and defenses does not always transfer to more complex datasets, such as ImageNet. Sacramento County Sheriff Scott Jones owes a debt of gratitude to Capt. Norm Leong of the Sacramento Police Department for averting a potential disaster. Leong intervened to prevent two young men, carrying placards with the image of a deputy killed on Monday, from confronting Black Lives Matter (BLM) protesters during a demonstration in downtown Sacramento on Tuesday afternoon.

Leong, with composure, blocked the path of these men as they approached BLM protesters who were shutting down J Street in front of the Sacramento Convention Center. He, along with other Sacramento city officers, ensured that these individuals and other pro-law enforcement demonstrators did not engage physically with the BLM demonstrators outside the annual conference of the California Peace Officers Association.

Had this protest escalated into violence, bloodshed, or mass arrests, the residents and workers of Sacramento would have rightly questioned Jones' actions and intentions.

On Monday, while addressing the media about the death of one of his officers, Jones urged those who support law enforcement to head to the convention center, anticipating BLM protests on Tuesday, six months after the shooting of Stephon Clark.

“We have a planned protest tomorrow at a statewide law enforcement conference in Sacramento,” Jones stated. “I know people have this overwhelming urge to do what they can. ... One of the things you can do is go down there. Go down to the convention center tomorrow between 11 and 1 and show your support for law enforcement.”

What did Jones expect? Emotions were already running high over the shooting death of Deputy Mark Stasyuk, a 27-year-old killed on Monday during a routine call in Rancho Cordova.

Choosing such a solemn moment to make a political statement under the guise of a call to action was ill-timed. And people responded. Groups, mainly older individuals, some carrying American flags and a couple wearing red "Make America Great Again" hats similar to those worn by President Donald Trump, gathered to support law enforcement and confront BLM.

The BLM group included clergy, a mix of white and African American individuals, and a diverse array of supporters. The pro-law enforcement side was primarily composed of older white individuals, along with some younger participants. I didn’t stay for the entire event, but I witnessed the tensest moments firsthand.

This clash of ideologies was on the verge of exploding.

As Leong worked to maintain peace, Jones' office issued a clarification on his earlier comments: “Sheriff Jones never called for a counterprotest—which would encourage responding persons to protest or address the planned protest directly—but rather gave the community an outlet for their grief and support where over a hundred Sheriff’s Department personnel and law enforcement from around the state will be gathered to learn better ways to police their communities.”

Really?

Re-read what Jones said on Monday and determine his true intent. It seemed like he was trying to correct one misstep by making another.

Le tribunal correctionnel du Brabant wallon a condamné mercredi J.D., un habitant de Jodoigne né en 1993, à dix-huit mois de prison, avec un sursis probatoire pour ce qui excède 12 mois. Son ancienne compagne, A.B., a écopé d'une peine de travail de 120 heures, qui sera convertie en un emprisonnement d'un an en cas d'inexécution. 

Ils étaient poursuivis pour avoir commis, en 2019, une vingtaine d'escroqueries ou tentatives d'escroquerie dans la région de Jodoigne et d'Hannut. Le procédé qu'ils utilisaient était assez particulier et ingénieux. Ils abordaient des personnes en invoquant un besoin urgent d'argent liquide, en inventant des prétextes difficiles à refuser : un enfant malade nécessitant une consultation médicale en urgence, un chien empoisonné à emmener immédiatement chez un vétérinaire, une carte bancaire avalée par un distributeur, un médicament à acheter dans une pharmacie du village, ou encore un sac à main volé.

Les prévenus affirmaient pouvoir rembourser leurs bienfaiteurs instantanément via une application bancaire sur smartphone. Ils montraient une opération démontrant le transfert immédiat de l'argent prêté de leur compte à celui des victimes. Cependant, il s'agissait d'une version "démo", et le paiement n'était jamais effectif. Ainsi, les personnes escroquées ne revoyaient jamais leur argent, des sommes allant généralement de 60 à 200 euros, qui étaient ensuite utilisées pour acheter de la cocaïne.

Concernant J.D., en situation de récidive, le sursis partiel accordé est soumis à condition : il devra s'abstenir de toute consommation de stupéfiants et se soumettre à un suivi médico-psychologique.

IMF（国际货币基金）在《外交政策》双周刊中警告称，新冠病毒疫情危机「远未到尽头」。虽然有数据显示经济正在复苏，但预计到2021年底全球经济将因疫情付出12兆美元（约355兆台币）的成本。

保加利亚籍IMF总裁克里斯塔琳娜·乔治耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）与该组织首席经济学家吉塔·戈皮纳特（Gita Gopinath）指出多边合作的必要性。她们表示：「经济复苏仍然脆弱，各区域与产业发展不均衡。为确保复苏进程持续，重要的是不能过早取消支援措施。」

乔治耶娃表示，自5月以来全球经济有所改善，许多经济体的前景比3个月前的预测并不那么悲观。然而，这并不意味着疫情影响已经减轻。她认为，尽管包括中国在内的一些经济体的复苏速度超出预期，某些地区逐渐克服了疫情带来的经济影响，但仍有许多发展中国家和新兴市场需要援助，甚至IMF对一些国家的展望可能会被调低。

她们预测，疫情带来的重大经济危机可能对人均收入较低的国家伤害更大。IMF已向75个国家提供紧急援助，其中包括47个低收入国家。报告还指出，各国政府必须合作来结束这场卫生危机，才能让市场有恢复的机会。尽管没有特指任何国家，美国发起对中国的贸易战以及计划对欧盟各国实施关税壁垒可能会破坏多边合作。

The article "Making Mona Lisa Smile" introduces a new invention, a computer that can recognize emotions. It can identify six basic emotions, including happiness, surprise, anger, disgust, fear, and sadness. I believe that the computer could be beneficial in some classrooms, depending on the subject. However, a facial expression does not always accurately convey an emotion.

This topic is highly debatable, as opinions vary. The concept of the "emotion reading computer" raises controversy, as there are ways to deceive it, such as through a fake smile. I don't think instructors should have to worry about the emotions of their students, as the focus should be on completing the assigned work. The article presents various opinions, but the attempt to sell the product, as evidenced by the statement, "The Mona Lisa demonstration is really intended to bring a smile to your face, while it shows just how much this computer can do (D'Alto, 6)," may not be convincing to all.

I am, personally, against the idea of the emotion-reading computer, as it appears to have many limitations.

Early Saturday, a high-speed vehicle chase from Hamilton City to Orland resulted in a suspect remaining at large and an Orland Police car sustaining damage. The incident began shortly after midnight when Glenn County Sheriff's Deputy Josh Brazzi responded to a call for service in Hamilton City, according to Sgt. Jim Miranda.

Deputy Brazzi observed a black Nissan Maxima run a stop sign and turn in front of him, narrowly missing a metal fence. The vehicle's erratic driving continued as it almost collided with a parked car. Brazzi activated his overhead lights, attempting to initiate a traffic stop. Initially, the vehicle appeared to slow down but then accelerated, disregarding stop signs and heading towards Orland on Highway 32 at speeds between 80 and 110 miles per hour.

As Brazzi pursued the suspect, the vehicle's speed was clocked at 110 mph on Papst Street. The chase continued through various streets in Orland, with the suspect persistently running stop signs at high speed. Sgt. Miranda noted, "He had a complete disregard for public safety."

Additional officers, including Orland Police Officer Terry Baker, joined the pursuit. When the suspect turned south onto A Street and into an alley, Baker moved to the opposite end of the alley to intercept the vehicle, while Brazzi continued the pursuit from behind. In the alley, the vehicle slowed to about 5 mph, at which point the suspect exited the car, jumped over a fence, and fled on foot. Deputy Brazzi exited his patrol car to follow the suspect.

Meanwhile, the unoccupied vehicle continued moving and collided head-on with Officer Baker's car. Both vehicles sustained minor damage, but Baker was not injured. Law enforcement units established a perimeter around the area, and Glenn County Deputy Kristy Akers, along with a patrol dog, conducted a search, but the suspect was not found.

Tanzanian President John Magufuli has confidently declared that his country has successfully eradicated coronavirus, attributing this achievement to the power of prayer, the efforts of local health officials, and frontline healthcare workers. He emphasized the importance of continued vigilance and precautionary measures despite the positive outlook.

Magufuli's remarks were made during a speech delivered at a church in Dodoma, the capital city of Tanzania, where he commended churchgoers for not wearing masks as a symbol of the country's victory over the virus and the diminishing fear among the population.

While the President claimed that there were only four Covid-19 patients left in hospitals in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania has not reported any new data on coronavirus cases since April 29. The last available figures from the World Health Organization indicated 509 reported cases and 21 deaths in the country.

Concerns have been raised by regional WHO officials regarding Tanzania's approach to social distancing and the decision to keep places of worship open despite the risks associated with large gatherings. The US Embassy in Tanzania issued a health alert in May, warning of the high risk of contracting Covid-19 due to overwhelmed hospitals in Dar es Salaam.

President Magufuli initially downplayed the seriousness of the virus in Tanzania, urging citizens to rely on prayer to combat the disease and dismissing the reported increase in positive cases as a result of faulty test kits. Despite this, the country has started to ease coronavirus restrictions, with universities, high schools, and international travel resuming while primary and secondary schools remain closed.

La Région Occitanie souhaite reprendre possession de sa propriété : l'Agropolis Museum. Le week-end dernier, les "gilets jaunes" y ont organisé un rassemblement national. Les deux parties ont présenté leurs projets pour le site lors de l'audience en référé qui s'est tenue ce mercredi après-midi au tribunal administratif de Montpellier.

Initialement, les "gilets jaunes" souhaitaient simplement tenir l'ADA, l'assemblée des assemblées, le week-end dernier, rassemblant plus de 500 personnes de toute la France. Cependant, le propriétaire de l'Agropolis Museum, en l'occurrence la Région, compte désormais récupérer les lieux. C'est pourquoi l'audience en référé de ce mercredi visait à "obtenir en urgence l'expulsion des occupants sans droit ni titre du bâtiment". Bien que trois personnes aient comparu devant le juge Thévenet, la requête a été immédiatement annulée à l'encontre de deux des défendeurs, qui "n'ont fait que passer" à l'Agropolis. Seule une personne était donc assignée : Florent Castineira, surnommé Casti. Ses partisans ont plaisanté en disant qu'il occupait seul l'Agropolis Museum, mais "avec de nombreux invités" après l'audience.

La Région : "Une atteinte à la sécurité et à la salubrité"
L'audience s'est principalement concentrée sur la sécurité, un point défendu par Me Constans au nom de la Région, soulignant la présence sur place d'une cuisinière, d'un réfrigérateur, d'un lit et de matériel électrique. Ces installations ont été effectuées sans respecter les normes de sécurité, d'après l'avocat, qui dénonce "une atteinte à la sécurité et à la salubrité". David Garcia, du service dédié de la Région, estime que le bâtiment est inadapté à toute occupation en raison du non-respect des normes de sécurité incendie. Me Constans a présenté un projet de réhabilitation de l'Agropolis Museum pour en faire "un lieu d'échange de données scientifiques entre les sites d'Agropolis et des logements pour les étudiants en agronomie".

Les "gilets jaunes" : "La Région a abandonné ce bâtiment"
Selon l'avocate de Casti, ce projet est "obsolète et opportunément présenté", exprimant son mécontentement : "La Région a abandonné ce bâtiment. Et ce n'est pas un bâtiment ordinaire !" Elle souligne que l'état des locaux est "meilleur maintenant qu'avant l'occupation", affirmant que "l'urgence n'est pas établie". Casti et ses partisans envisagent même d'organiser des activités sociales (friperies, cantine populaire...) dans ce bâtiment inoccupé depuis la fermeture du musée il y a neuf ans, parfois squatté.

L'affaire a été mise en délibéré.

Diffusion Models (DMs) have emerged as powerful tools in generative modeling, demonstrating a notable aptitude for producing high-quality samples while maintaining a stable and resilient training process. They have been extensively utilized in a variety of tasks, including image synthesis (Dhariwal & Nichol, 2021; Ho et al., 2020; Song et al., 2021b), image super-resolution (Saharia et al., 2022b; Gao et al., 2023), image restoration (Chung et al., 2022; Luo et al., 2023), image editing (Avrahami et al., 2022; Meng et al., 2021), and image-to-image translation (Zhao et al., 2022; Su et al., 2022). However, compared to alternative generative models like Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) (Goodfellow et al., 2014), DMs often require multiple function evaluations, which limits their applicability in real-time scenarios.

As a result, a substantial body of research is focused on designing fast diffusion model samplers. These fast samplers are generally categorized into training-based and training-free methods. Training-based methods can generate high-quality samples in as few as 2 to 4 sampling steps (Salimans & Ho, 2021; Meng et al., 2023; Song et al., 2023), but they require retraining, which can be costly. Conversely, training-free methods utilize raw information directly without retraining, providing broad applicability and high flexibility. Song et al. (2021b) have shown that the image generation process is equivalent to solving stochastic differential equations (SDEs) or ordinary differential equations (ODEs) in reverse time.

The core of training-free methods lies in designing efficient solvers for SDEs (Bao et al., 2022; Zhang et al., 2023) or ODEs (Lu et al., 2022a; Zhang & Chen, 2023; Zhao et al., 2023). ODE-based approaches have achieved notable success, with UniPC (Zhao et al., 2023) achieving rapid sampling in up to 10 steps. However, exploration into SDE solvers remains limited. While ODE-based deterministic sampling is more straightforward, SDE-based stochastic samplers add additional noise to the data state at each step, posing more challenges. Nevertheless, SDEs enhance the diversity of generated images, catering to industries such as art creation and game development.

In this work, we propose a unified framework for DMs, introducing an Extended SDE formulation (see Fig. 2). Within this framework, we define a solution space and design highly effective SDE solvers. Specifically, we model the sampling process as an Extended Reverse-Time (ER) SDE, extending the work of Song et al. (2021b) and Zhang & Chen (2023). Inspired by Lu et al. (2022a), we reveal the semi-linear structure inherent in the ER SDE solutions, which consist of linear functions of data variables, nonlinear functions parameterized by neural networks, and noise terms. Building on this, we deduce exact solutions for both Variance Exploding (VE) SDE and Variance Preserving (VP) SDE (Song et al., 2021b) by analytically computing the linear portions and noise terms, thereby circumventing discretization errors. We also provide practical approximations of arbitrary orders for both VP and VE SDEs.

By analyzing the errors in the approximate solutions of the ER SDE, we discover varying levels of discretization errors due to different noise scales during the reverse process. This phenomenon gives rise to a solution space within the ER SDE, where the optimal solution aligns with ODE. This demonstrates mathematically that SDE-based methods perform worse when the number of steps is limited. We also establish that VP SDE solvers achieve image quality equivalent to VE SDE solvers, given consistent pretrained models. Furthermore, by carefully selecting noise scale functions, we develop specialized Extended Reverse-Time SDE Solvers (ER-SDE-Solvers) that not only enhance image diversity but also rival ODE solvers in rapid sampling.

Stay vigilant, and don't fall for these deceptive schemes circulating on the platform. Trust reliable sources and verified information to navigate through the evolving landscape of messaging apps.

The community has rallied around Lance "Stretch" Voice following the devastating loss of his beloved animals and home. Many community members have contributed to the cause. Tracey's workplace, the Commercial Hotel and Liquor Store, has raised over $2,000 through coin collections alone.

Kim Gardiner, owner of the Waihi Underground Market, organized an auction of various items, along with haircuts and face painting last weekend, raising over $2,000 as well.

Individuals like Rhonda Walch took to the streets with her dogs and a few other puppy pals to collect donations, raising $130 last week in the town center.

Additionally, miniature horses were featured at the Waihi Underground Market over the weekend, and pony and cart rides brought in $150.

Life on Earth had changed drastically since the first Flood, which wiped out countless cities built below sea level. Advocates of global warming and climate change insisted they had been right all along, asserting that our selfishness and denial had doomed us, as vast sections of frozen continents like Greenland and Antarctica melted away.

Three months later, the world endured the harshest winter ever recorded, and the planet refroze. World leaders convened and vowed to swiftly transition to renewable energy to prevent a recurrence. It seemed to work, for a while. Until scientists in Antarctica began reporting significant polar cap losses once more.

The subsequent Flood was more devastating than the first, as was the following winter. Year after year, more land was swallowed, until it became evident that the next Flood might leave no land at all.

The U.N. held emergency meetings. Frantic and fearful, world leaders struggled to reach a consensus. Some, like the U.S. and the U.K., proposed constructing a fleet of boats to preserve the population. Russia began erecting massive buildings to stay above the flood, while China built colossal walls to hold the waters at bay.

Churches, of all religions and denominations, overflowed as the next Flood approached, a testament to the tendency of the lost and frightened to seek a higher power. Liquor stores, too, were rapidly selling out, as people turned to alcohol to cope. Meanwhile, news stations capitalized on the looming threat, highlighting the failure of the authorities to act in time.

Then, the Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research, SCAR, delivered the news. 

The polar caps were melting more slowly than in the previous years, and the upcoming Flood, the scientists suggested, might, in fact, be mild.

Entropy is commonly understood as a measure of disorder. However, it can also be seen as a measure of uniformity and symmetry. As we will demonstrate, when constraints are absent, maximizing entropy leads to a uniform, equal-weight, or translation-invariant distribution. On the other hand, the introduction of information reduces entropy, creating nonuniformities. Symmetries, considered as uniformities across transformations or translations, naturally align with states of higher entropy. Therefore, the prevalence of symmetries in physics may not indicate a delicate, precariously maintained balance, but rather, a state of maximal entropy, given the constraints imposed by external forces. When stricter constraints are applied, certain symmetries may break, yet the system tends to maintain the most "uniform" or "symmetric" distribution, in line with the new constraints. Entropy, symmetry, and information are fundamental, appearing ubiquitously. In a mathematical context, the symmetries of a theory can be seen as dual to the axiomatic constraints of the theory.

Venus, the second planet from the sun, presents a formidable challenge for human exploration due to its inhospitable conditions. The thick atmosphere consisting of nearly 97 percent carbon dioxide and the intense surface temperatures exceeding 800 degrees Fahrenheit make it impossible for humans to survive there. Despite the many unmanned missions that have been sent to Venus, no spacecraft has been able to land and function for more than a few hours on the planet's surface for over three decades.

The distance between Earth and Venus varies, posing another obstacle to studying the planet. While humans have sent multiple spacecraft to Venus, the harsh conditions have prevented any successful landings for an extended period. The extreme atmospheric pressure and temperature on Venus make it a perilous environment for humans to explore.

Efforts to overcome the challenges of Venus exploration are underway, with NASA working on potential solutions to the planet's hostile conditions. One approach involves the concept of floating above the planet's surface, akin to how jet airplanes navigate turbulent weather by flying at higher altitudes. While this method presents its own risks, it offers a potential avenue for conducting research on Venus.

In summary, the complexities of Venus, from its harsh atmosphere to the extreme temperatures, make it a daunting task for humans to study the planet up close. The barriers to exploration, including the hazardous conditions and the lack of suitable technology, underscore the formidable nature of Venus as a target for scientific inquiry.

Fans of Dave Chappelle's Comedy Central series, Chappelle's Show, will be surprised if they attempt to watch the stand-up comedian's sketch show on Netflix tonight. This is because Chappelle's Show has been removed from the streaming platform. The comedy series was initially released on both Netflix and HBO Max on November 1, marking a significant move for Chappelle, who has maintained a multi-special deal with Netflix for years. Chappelle even highlighted this major release event during his opening monologue while hosting the most recent episode of Saturday Night Live.

However, the situation took a turn in the weeks following the show's debut on Netflix and HBO Max. On Tuesday, Chappelle uploaded a video to his Instagram titled "Unforgiven." This 18-minute video appears to have been recorded during a recent set by Chappelle. In it, he reveals that he was the one who initiated the removal of Chappelle's Show from Netflix. He linked this decision to ongoing disputes with ViacomCBS and Comedy Central, alleging that they did not compensate him as part of the show's licensing agreement.

In the video, Chappelle elaborates on his history of disagreements with Viacom and why he departed from Chappelle's Show in 2005. He stated, "If you are streaming that show, you are fencing stolen goods. They stole that (show) from me, they just took it," and further expressed, "I found out these people were streaming my work and never had to ask me or they never had to tell me. Perfectly legal because I signed the contract, but is that right? I didn’t think so."

Chappelle expressed gratitude to Netflix for respecting his request to remove the show, sharing with his audience, "(Netflix) agreed that they would take it off their platform just so I could feel better. That’s why I [work] with Netflix because they pay me my money, they do what they say they are going to do, and they went above and beyond what you could expect from a businessman."

The veteran stand-up then appealed directly to his audience, expressing his pain and disappointment with his treatment by Viacom: "So I’m not going to the agents, I’m coming to my real boss — I’m coming to you. I’m begging you — if you ever liked me, if you ever think there was anything worthwhile about me, I’m begging you, please don’t watch that show.

"The 'face' on Mars was not made by aliens," said the chief scientist for NASA's Mars Exploration Program, Jim Garvin. Many scientists were skeptical about the Face being an alien artifact, with most believing it to be a natural landform. However, the curiosity surrounding the Face led NASA to prioritize photographing Cydonia, a region known for its mesas.

When the Mars Global Surveyor flew over Cydonia on April 5, 1998, a high-resolution image was captured, which was ten times sharper than the previous Viking images. The image was made available to the public, sparking excitement and anticipation, only to reveal the Face as a natural landform, disappointing those who had hoped for evidence of alien structures.

Despite the clear image, some individuals continued to believe the Face was an alien monument, attributing its lack of visibility in previous images to the planet's atmospheric conditions.

Driven by the need to perform tasks in remote environments, teleoperation has emerged as a central robotic paradigm with applications ranging from deep sea exploration to outer space missions. A significant challenge in this domain is generating smooth, goal-directed robot trajectories when discrepancies exist between operator and remote robot workspaces. This problem remains largely unaddressed among the state-of-the-art teleoperation frameworks and is illustrated with a valve-turning example, depicted in Fig. 1. 

In this paper, we propose an object-centered motion mapping framework for continuous bilateral teleoperation. Our main objective is to overcome the limitations of naive joint space mappings and enhance teleoperation by using object-centered representations. As shown in Fig. 2, direct joint space mappings impose strong embodiment constraints, which many teleoperation frameworks attempt to mitigate through task space representations. However, even simple differences between local and remote environments can cause failures in remote robot execution. This necessitates object-centered approaches, although they often scale poorly with the number of objects involved.

A common solution is to pause communication between the haptic device and the remote robot, relocating the haptic device and continuing the task based on visual feedback. Yet, this discontinuous manipulation leads to low efficiency and transparency, particularly in tasks involving multiple objects. Our approach reshapes the task space to ensure that the robot adapts to points of interest differing between the two sides, maintaining continuity, smoothness, and precision.

Our primary contribution is an object-centered formulation for task space motion mapping between the local and remote robot, which includes: 
1) adaptability to different object poses between local and remote workspaces (either real or virtual); 
2) invertible and continuously differentiable position and orientation mappings; 
3) bilateral teleoperation capabilities, utilizing impedance control for both haptic guidance and compliant interaction with the environment.

We employ a bilateral teleoperation setup with two Franka Emika Panda robots. One serves as a haptic device on the operator's side, while the other acts as a remote robot in the targeted environment. This setup allows the operator to focus on the local setup, driving the input device to execute tasks locally, while the remote robot performs them synchronously despite different object poses.

To achieve the proposed mappings, we present two possible implementations: an iterative approach and a neural network (NN) approach, detailed in Sections IV and V, respectively. Experimental results in Section VII indicate that the neural network approach is more advantageous due to faster mapping evaluations, demonstrating the efficacy of our proposed framework.
